text: One star is too many for this place. We just went for the first time tonight. Our waitress was slow and lazy. We waited 15minutes before the server "noticed" us (she was busy talking to coworkers). We ordered some sushi and spring rolls. The sushi is cheap and skimpy, spring rolls were bland. We ate less than 1/2 the sushi and sat waiting for our server to check on us (still busy talking to coworkers). With no more to drink and sitting, waiting to get help for 1/2 hour, the server finally noticed us glaring at her and came over to see if we wanted anything else. We said "no" because nothing was good. She left saying nothing and after 10 minutes just dropped our check at the table. We were comped a good portion of the bill, but no manager came to see us and the waitress never mentioned it. Really all they needed to do is not ignore us and if they would have checked in shortly after we were served, we could have tried something else and maybe saved the meal. We will not be back.  In summation, the food was poor quality, the service was awful, management is mia. No idea how this place stays open.

This is my favorite cenpho sushi place. Other than Hana which is awesome. I really enjoy the spicy edamame and the jalepenko roll. I have not had anything bad though. We go once a Month or so and usually share some rolls. The people are very friendly, food is always awesome, and the place is cute. It's win win!

Good food, casual joint! The servers are very nice and the owner is often around. The only reason I didn't five star is that there are other local places that I think have slightly better sushi however, this place is very good!!

We live by MOTO so we are kinda stuck when it comes to sushi establishments. The sushi blows. You can tell it isn't fresh fish and never taste super. The Mojo & beers are the only good things. I don't really trust a sushi place that hides the sushi makers in the kitchen...stuff probably looks like week old shit which it is.

Very serviceable the few times I've been.   Won't blow you away but the food is good. The Las Vegas roll is delicious. Tootsie rolls are good too.   A bit pricey if you really get in a sushi mood. Atmosphere is good and service is generally good.   Decor is a bit weird especially if you get seated in the awkward area in the back near the rest rooms.

This place is awesome. Everything is so professional yet quirky and I love it. I could spend like 30 minutes reading the menu because of all the little hidden jokes on it... including their continuously updated plea never to touch their blinds (which, you totally should when they aren't looking, because they are made of cool beads!).   The sushi is all fresh and tasty and very cheap during happy hour (10% off everything, 50% off some rolls).   I am not saying you should mention the word underground to your server but I am not saying you shouldn't either, and if you do you may be rewarded with very delicious menu options...

Walked in last night. The hostess refused to seat us at the round booth because when the restaurant closes, that's where the staff "puts their stuff." Made no sense considering it was 8 pm and they closed at "about 10." Were seated toward back. Only three other parties in restaurant area, a couple of people at bar. The server brought us food menus. We asked for drink menus. She seemed very bothered by us and said everything was already put away for the night......again, confirmed they closed at 10 since it was only 8....10 minutes passed by and she was behind the bar doing nothing at all the whole time, still no drink menus. So we decided to leave. Clearly we were not welcome. As we walked by her on our way out, she laughed. I repeat: LAUGHED at us as she sarcastically said "sorry." I am not easily bothered by this sort of ignorance but considering how often I have been here, I was very offended as well as my two friends. We all have always come here but can say never again. I feel bad for the owner because I have seen him working there himself almost every time I have gone to eat. If he only knew the type of business he is losing due to staff. It's a shame.

This was by far my worst experience ever at a supposed sushi restaurant. I stopped by for lunch this afternoon and ordered some nigiri (salmon, yellowtail, tuna) and a few rolls (spicy yellowtail and Kalifornia [yes, they have a version spelled with a "k"]). Pretty standard fare and definitely nothing too exotic.   The yellowtail looked as if someone had intended to throw it away until I ordered it (then someone there must have decided, "Why throw it away when we can serve it to this guy instead!"). It was dry, rubbery, obviously spoiled and rancid. The spicy yellowtail was even worse. It might have been even older than the nigiri pieces they gave me since they tried to douse it in whatever awful spice-ridden concoction to mask the truly disgusting taste of the fish underneath.  I was truly offended that these people would even serve this and try to pass it off as edible food. I honestly should have notified the health department immediately.  Needless to say, avoid this place if you have any respect for yourself.

I have been here twice. Both times I had a very positive experience. I have received good service, the price point is fine, and my menu selections have all been good. Is the greatest japanese food ever? No. But, hey, we're in Phoenix. If you want your world rocked, drive to San Diego. If you're looking for good food in the neighborhood and a nice, low key atmosphere, give it a shot.

As a sushi place, this is awful.  No salmon (only smoked), and the rest of the (small selection) of fish has always been fishy smelling and questionable quality.  I've been here 3 times and its mediocre at best.  Sake selection is small, 1 or 2 low end choices.  However, to give them credit, they do have a good beer lineup and their cooked japanese style food is very good.  Service has always been excellent.

Awesome happy hour with half off rolls and the nachos are bomb. The beer selection is pathetic, but what do you expect from a sushi place. Just know your boy and girl signs for the bathroom so you don't make the same mistake my boyfriend did, think about Austin Powers. In all honesty, one of our favorite places to go!
Amazing place!!! The most friendly place in Arizona without a doubt! Everyone is extremely nice and food is fantastic!

Mediocre sushi and HORRIBLE service! Our server took about ten minutes to get us water. We had to ask for a drink menu four times, and still never received it. Maybe our waitress felt awkward since she kept forgetting? The entire time we were there it felt like we were bothering her. I could understand if they were busy why the wait was so long, only thing is.....there were six tables in the whole restaurant! They had three servers working, as well as another women who maybe was a manager? Oh, and two people cleaning tables. I work in the food service industry and know what good service is, and this was far from it. When we finally got our sushi it wasn't anything special. I wish Moto was a thousand times better, since it is so close to home, but I guess now I know why I never really went back after the last time. I just can't believe even after asking four times we never got a drink menu. I'd think our waitress would want to make money and keep us happy. Maybe they treat customers with children like they don't matter. When we asked for a highchair the guy said he didn't know if they had any, and he wasn't a hostess!! I don't know how this place stays in business.

Modern decor and great service.  Sunday happy hour brought us Asian nachos and a tootsie roll.  The Asian nachos were inventive and pretty darn good.  Tootsie roll was pretty standard, and missing the sauce.  Not amazing, but good.  I'll be back.

The wonton soup was pretty good. The broth and veggies were tasty. The noodle part of the wontons were also good. The meat was a little off.  The pad thai was also decent. A tad spicy for our taste. It was also a little pricey. But, the portion was large!  I would probably give it a 3.5 if I could.

Why do I come here? Every time I do I promise myself it will be the last time. Went in got lunch today around 12:40. There were 6 tables including ours. It took over 5 minutes to get water on the table. We ordered a gyoza, a tootsie roll and a spicy tuna roll. It took an additional 30 mins for that to come out. Our waiter was rude and short with us, hardly came to the table at all. I didn't try the spicy tuna because I'm 9.5 months pregnant but my sister couldn't even choke it down because the fish tasted bad. We had to scarf our food down because my sister had to return to work. We didn't  anticipate it taking 40 minutes for two sushi rolls and some fried dumplings. It would have been one thing if it was busy, but it wasn't. And every time I come here the service gets worse. Seriously moto, this is the last time!

Ohhhh Suburbia.  Only you would have a sushi place with the chairs up on the tables at 9:40 on a Saturday Night.     I stopped by to check this place out after some christmas shopping errands, around 9:30 this Saturday.  Being a fan of sushi and craft beer, this was on my list to check out.   The waitress came by and handed me a list of beers on a folded piece of paper from her pocket.  I was really stoked with the selection.  I ordered a Dogfish Head 90min IPA.  The lovely waitress returned only to crush my hopes by saying that was an old list and that they didnt have any Dogfish Head on tap.  (Insert trombone failure sound effect here.  :::Waaahhh Wahhhhhh:::: ) Then she gave me a newer folded piece of paper with a slightly less appealing selection.  However, i found a tasty IPA and pulled the trigger.    I perused the menu... everything has "Krab" which must mean its artificial crab.  Most rolls also have something tempura.  This is classic tell-tale sign that they keep minimal fresh fish on hand.  Given that it is 9:30p on a saturday night and there is only one other table there, it's probably a good thing. This place doesn't get much traffic, so a lot of fish wouldn't sell fast enough.    I asked the waitress if these "inside out rolls" were their specialty rolls.  She said, nope, i have another secret list for that.  She slips me the folded paper list.  I'm starting to feel like i'm on a treasure hunt!  So exciting.  What other fun lists might she have up her sleeve?!  I ordered a Senorita roll because it is one of the only ones with fresh tuna on top of the roll.  The roll was large.  It wasn't cut with precision, some pieces were much larger than others, some smaller. (The place was empty, so it wasn't that the sushi chef was busy and rushed, he was just lazy.)  The Krab filling was Meh.  The tuna on top was tasty, but was certainly frozen, so it wasn't super.  Overall, the mediocrity of the roll was hidden by a lot of sweet eel sauce and some tempura crunchies.    As far as sushi places go, i'd give it a C. However, thanks to their good beer list and given that most suburban peeps wouldnt notice the difference between fresh never-frozen and frozen fish... As far as suburban restaurants go, id give it a B.  If you really like sushi, go somewhere else.  If you just want a good beer in the neighborhood and a passable roll to fill you up, then this place is perfect.  (I'll probably be back for that exact reason.)  If you've recently been on a date to Olive Garden or Red Lobster.  You will think this place is amazing.  Then again, you'll probably order a bud light too.

Regular customers.  Like the food but went in tonight while it was busy and got horrible service- from the owner no less!  It's on thing to be busy but to be blown off like we were was very disappointing.  We probably wont go back.  Definitely won't recommend.

I've been coming here since it opened. I've made excuses for it many times because I enjoyed the convenient sushi it consistently provided. I never understood why a section of the bar always has a reserved sign just in case the owner showed up. But I kept coming even though I felt my kids were unwelcome (broken high chairs and menu instructions about keeping them from touching the blinds) because I wanted them to enjoy sushi instead of chicken nuggets. After the anniversary party I just can't take it anymore. What's with the Teen Mom wedding style zebra vases and Ikea style cafeteria tables that are so narrowly placed they scream awkward at the thought of squeezing through them?! Now an entire new serving staff dressed like a mechanics with a red handkerchief. I'm done.

I've eaten here several times, the food is good but service is slacking. 4 star food/atmosphere but 2 star service. They used to have 2 great bartenders but they've since moved on. The current staff is extremely unprofessional, including the kitchen staff. They are always having there own conversations while we sit and wait for someone to fill our drinks or take our order. I've watched our food sit in the window for several minutes with no one else willing to deliver our food while the bartender is busy(no teamwork at all). They get overwhelmed very easily and can't handle a crowd. I've overheard the owner talking about how he hates yelp which is just not something you want to hear. We will be back as it's in the neighborhood and the unlimited sushi is a great deal on Saturdays.
really nice staff...good beer selection...ok sushi

Excellent service and food.  It was my first time eating Shashimi.  They served the tuna in the shape of a rose.  The friend I was with is an experienced sushi eater.  He thought it was very good.  Happy hour prices were good.  Half price rolls.
I love Moto.  I have eaten here at least 50 times.  I always get the Exit Wound Bowl.  It is easily my favorite dish at all the Phx establishments I have eaten.  I highly recommend Moto.

This is the ultimate Asian gastro pub and not a traditional sushi place. The beer menu is so outstanding I do not think there is a better one in the central corridor. The sushi is always delightful. The bowls are spicy and are a super value. The seaweed salad is super sized and very good. Miso is also good. I have never had a bad meal. The only negatives are the seating options for large groups, inconsistent and sometime sloppy wait staff and the dearth of parking.

I say use this place for cocktails.  We agreed, sitting at the corner of the bar that: 1. it was difficult to hear each other 2. the amount of krab mix on the menu was unfortunate 3. there was a noticeable lack of patio 4. we've had better service  There is an underground menu, but we only learned about that by overhearing the wait staff talking to other customers. They neglected the second half of our order, and finally we cancelled it and left.   Overall, I agree that this place seems like a great concept but falls down a little in its execution.

Very disappointed. Sushi had way too much rice (some nearly inedible). Menu seemed to be obscure, just to be obscure.  Spring rolls were chock-full of 'filler'.  Not what we were expecting...with a $75 bill.

One of my girlfriends comes here a lot on Sunday's with her husband. So  when she and I decided to grab dinner I suggested her usual sushi joint. It was my first time and was pretty busy for a Saturday night. Service was quick and efficient and I like their variety of beers they had on tap. I got the Vegas roll, it was good but didn't have a lot of fish in it. More rice than anything. I will be back though, it's close and I like to support local business' in Phoenix. Next time I'll try more of a variety of what they offer.

You know you're in a sushi place when you walk in and it smells like a fish market... in a good way. Food was super fresh well prepared. The September roll was spicy crispy excellent. The veggie spring roll was plenty big as an appetizer, however that steamed vegetables were kind of bland. Great service too!

I must confess, I didn't try to the sushi here, but I plan on going back another time to try it out.  But what I did try, the Curry Soup and the Potstickers were quite good.  I met a friend there for lunch, and it was quite busy, but we were able to snag a table without a wait.  There seemed to be some confusion as to who our waitress was, and we had like 3 different ones try to take our beverage order, but eventually they sorted it out.  The Curry Soup was divine!  Red curry, coconut, a bit of heat combined with the sweet crab and rice made this the perfect soup in my book!  The potstickers were nice and crispy, and the food came out pretty quickly.  My friend got a basic sushi roll (California) and said it was good too.  I do want to come back and try the sushi, especially the dessert sushi, which looked really yummy. The inside decor is modern, clean and comfortable, making for a nice dining atmosphere.  I would have given them 4 stars but they don't have a lunch menu, and it is kinda on the pricey side when considering lunch.  Most sushi places offer lunch bento boxes, but not Moto, and I really think they should jump on that bandwagon!

Awful. Bar wings were inedible, the beef was inedible, the seared tuna was gray and disgusting, and the rolls were boring.  Sixty dollars later, and my daughter and I left most of the food on our plate. Server was indifferent.

Place is garbage, over priced, with lousy service.  Went there last nigh had a party of 5, Cyndi thought she needed to add 20% gratuity to our bill so she didn't have to really work for a tip. Just an awful place.

My husband and I have really enjoyed our weekly visits to Moto Sushi.  We love the location, and the vibe inside as well. All the sashimi and rolls have been wonderful.  Thank you!  Highly suggest visiting!

We have been to Moto many times because the service and the food used to be great.  We went tonight for the first time in months (at my recommendation) and the service was HORRIBLE. We walked in, said we had reservations, they were empty - and sat us at a four top high table - fine!  Perfect.  After that - we sat for 15 min before we got a drink order, 15 more minutes before the drinks came along with the edamamee, and then we waited an additional hour and 15 min before we ever got our food of which we had to ask for on two occasions.  The female server kept apologizing but blaming it on the cooks and that they never saw the order she put in.  The wonton soup was cold, bland and not worth eating.  I also ordered the wok shrimp with sesame sauce but it was served with teriyaki and the shrimp was obviously pre-frozen, and hard.  Horrible.  I shared as much with her and not once did she say, I'm sorry, or let me take that off the bill.  I'm in the hospitality, resort F&B industry and have been for 30+ years and because we were with company (who shared my views) I remained silent to mgt.

I really don't like this place for sushi. The fish definitely comes from frozen and there's a lot of imitation crab meat being used.   On the other hand, the rice and noodle bowls are excellent. I'll definitely keep coming here but no more sushi.   Oh yeah, drinks are always good and there is a quality beer selection.

The sushi is always delicious, especially the ones listed on the underground menu (the volcano roll is to die for). We always go there for every special occasion. While it's true that the service is slow on Saturdays due to their all-you-can eat sushi special, I otherwise have no complaints.

This has been a nice little spot for our family over the years.  The Sushi is decent, good atmosphere, not too busy and great menu. But one thing we always forget is how bad the service is. If you're going to impress and take a large order from memory, you better get it right. Yet they never do! Advice, for parties of 4 or more, please do not try to remember everything by memory. The kind server forgot 4 Miso soups, 2 rolls, and our appetizer. Then as usual we waited 20 minutes for our bill to be brought while he fraternized behind the bar with his buddies. If the service is ever brought up to par, this could really be one of the better hidden gems in the area.

I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked this place.  I was in a large group (which is usually never good).  We ordered some appetizers, which were pretty good.  Sweet potato fries (Japanese? I don't think so) and calamari (very small).  I ordered a sushi combo which had both sushi and sashimi for a very reasonable price.  The person next to me had one of their bowls.  It was delicious.  I kept asking if I could try it again (that is so rude), but it really was good.  Some kind of spicy chicken bowl. I also had a beer that was really good.  I don't remember the name, but it was delicious.   I will be back for sure, to check out some of their other dishes.

Very pleasantly surprised by Moto Sushi, this being said from some one that has ate an enormous amount of Great sushi in the Northwest ( Seattle, Vancouver, and San Fran). I was very skeptical at first, because it's dicey in Phoenix when it comes to getting good fresh Sushi. Ordered the eda mame and spring rolls for appetizers, both were great!! The plum sauce for the spring rolls was delicious. Ordered alaska roll and rainbow roll, and I was not disappointed at all. The place itself was very busy when we arrived, however the service was timely and on point. I would recommend this place to anyone that comes to Phoenix for sushi. Prices are not bad either, and by the looks of the Happy Hour menu very good prices to get your sushi on. I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could.
Everything I have eaten here is THE best version of it I have had. The dishes are creative, beer is cold and the atmosphere is a positive buzz.

A friend took me to this restaurant because we were looking for Asian food on a Sunday evening, not too easy in Phoenix if you're not fond of chains.  We ate at the bar, had delicious crispy egg rolls, veggie bowl, I could just see families around us having wonderful food and especially enjoying the great friendly service, very relaxed but also fast and helpful in deciding what to order (I'm very conservative regarding spice and sushi)  Super clean, very affordable, all kinds of beer and wine.  Owner on the premises!  I will be going there often!
This is truthfully the best sushi place in town! when your there dont forget to ask for the secret menu.....
What can I say? It's sushi and I love it. The Senorita roll is one of my favorites! Place isn't big and gets packed pretty quickly. You can't go wrong with any of their sushi selections there.

Lunch sushi combo was just about as good as any other sushi I have had in Phoenix.  The Yellowtail tasted fresh, and the spicy tuna roll was better than most places in town.  Our young, attractive waitress with a baby belly was great.  She recommended the Moto Wings in "Mustard Gas" sauce.  It was very good and not too spicy.  We looked at the beer list, and we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of brews.  Happy hours looks enticing with $3 16 oz barley pops.  This place does feel a little like RA.  However, there is no RA bad food or RA "I'm too attractive to really work" waitstaff as far as I can tell.  I will be back for HH and to try other food on the big menu.  $25 for two at lunch.

This was my first restaurant in Phoenix. I was taken here for a lunch prior to an interview I had. I was pretty nervous about the whole situation so I don't remember too many details, but I would recommend this place if you're a sushi lover or on the go and need a quick lunch to eat at your desk. Service was great too.

Good sushi and nice sized plates for the price. Haven't tried drinks yet but its on the to-do list. Figure out the hidden menu before you go, if thats your kind of thing. I always feel weird ordering off of it, but it makes them smile. Go for happy hour and save some happy money for that pocket of yours! And if you're anything like me.. you will walk through the door and think "HELLO MOTO!"

We tried it again. It was worse. The place is dirty, the owner is sitting and leering in the corner, the simple sushi was incorrect and the chalk sign on the way out says "Hate us on Yelp, because we care".  Okay, I will hate you on Yelp...and in person, to your face and to everyone I know. I don't get it. Why even have a business if you don't care about your customers? I can only imagine how you treat your employees if this is how you treat your customers.  Good luck.  P.S. congratulations on the overtly racist banner out front. You managed to include sexism, racism and imperialism in one sentence.

Sashimi is always fresh. Love the beer selection which they seem to mix up often. Great happy hour pricing. Sports on the LCD tv's. I love this place. Off hours are best. Beat the rush and get great service. Check it out.
Mediocre sushi and god-awful service. My wife and I, both ex-servers from our college years, tried them three times. Every time the service was infuriating and the food bland. Save your money.

i was looking forward to trying moto for quite some time. but upon arrival for an 8pm dinner we sat down to be very rushed. the sever was very rude. but once receiving 4 different sushi rolls i had to tune out the annoying staff rushing people out the door because it was delicious! i would have loved to stay and try more but the waitress said the kitchen was closed and reminded us once more they close at 9pm. awesome food and prices... not so friendly service and hours.

4 stars only because the only thing I dislike here is the bill. Food and service are always outstanding. When I get the Exit Wound for takeout, it is actually one of the most economical meals I can get. The Exit Wound is very spicy, but not so much that the other flavors get hidden in that, but the best thing about this meal are all of the different textures. It is a great experience to get this, but only if you can handle the heat.

Ordered two bowls of noodle with the wife.  An hour after walking in the door, we still didn't have noodles.    The waitress walked by 6 or seven times and was avoiding making eye contact.  Finally we had to leave to pick up our kids, not having eaten, not having had any sort of good service.  The waitress couldn't fathom why we would leave after having already been there about an hour.  I have eaten here before and it has decent food but I won't be wasting anymore of my time here.  The complete lack of an attempt at service or even acknowledging the lack of it is inexcusable in a service industry with so many options.  Hana has better Sushi/Japanese and is very near by on 7th ave.

This place has gone downhill.  I'm not the first to say it.  I used to forgive many of my issues with this restaurant, mostly because they had a great happy hour.  I used to go about once a week.  They have since raised the price of happy hour sushi by $2, less appetizer and beer options are available.   The asian nachos seem alright for a minute, but they quickly become impossible to eat.  It's just not a good idea.  The sweet potato fries are weak.  A while back, I had a noodle dish and the vegetable Pho.  They were both overly sweetened.  After that, and the change to happy hour, I wasn't planning on going back.  I went back for the vegetable/tofu Pho, and because I asked about other vegan items they informed me the TOFU PHO now CONTAINS BEEF BROTH!!!  This is absurd.  I know beef broth is traditional, but this "Fusion" restaurant should at least try to have some dishes for vegans, and vegetarians for that matter.  Wow, i'm speechless.  The service is sub-par, and the menu is littered with snobby comments and jokes that belittle the customer.  All forgivable with a solid happy hour and a soup for vegans.  Bye Bye Moto.
Best sushi in the valley. Must try their all you order until the paramedic comes to revive you every Saturday from 11-2:30.

I come here when I have a group of friends, some want sushi and others don't like it. The pan-Asian menu satisfies everyone! It's a narrow space. I think it would be hard to seat more than 6 or 8 together.  I get the rice bows (4-step entrée), which are PLENTIFUL. I ordered the larger, plate-size. It was more than 2 meals for me.  All the sauces on the 4-step entrées are really good. I can't decide which one I like best.    The (all young, all female) servers wear tank-tops, and they all have the same look/aura. That worries me that the manager is hiring based on looks, not professionalism.    The sushi is good and comes out quickly. I have not tried their all-you-can-eat, but if you do, beware: there are lots of rules posted.    The owner's wry sense of humor pervades the place (menu, website, table tents....) Sometimes it works, sometimes it degrades the atmosphere.   I mentioned to the owner once that I thought someone made a mistake with my sauce. It was too hot for me to finish my dish.  I told him I thought he should check that batch of sauce. I had eaten it other times with no problems. He giggled and told me a wild story about his plans to add an "exit-wound level of spiciness to the menu. So hot it burns twice!"  I wished he had taken me seriously. BTW the "exit-wound bowl" is now on the menu.... see what I mean about his sense of humor?

I love Moto. The food is great, love the music and casual atmosphere. They have a great happy hour! Their menu has so many things we like, but you should try the nachos, bar wings, and of course the sushi.  My daughter brought some friends here for her birthday, our server was fantastic! The staff is always friendly and attentive. In my experience, it has an inviting feel. It's our neighborhood place to go for sushi.

Sushi was wonderful. We tried 5 different choices. The cucumber salad was to die for. The Build Your Own Bowls were bland, both rice & noodle.  Service was only okay. She wasn't the friendliest and we had to wait for longer than normal each time we needed anything, ie. Wine, napkins.

I had to take my to-go order back 3 times because they got it wrong and the 3rd time, I took 5 bites of my salad before realizing there were crispy noodles in there that I SPECIFICALLY asked them not to put in because I have Celiac Disease and can't tolerate gluten.  Needless to say, I got very sick and am now home in bed instead of at work because of it. The girl at the take out counter, Tina, had the audacity to tell me it was my fault because she didn't hear me say it the second time I had to call back in because my order was wrong.  The 3rd time I went in after I realized I was going to get sick, I just asked for a refund.  The tall guy working was very nice and apologized over and over saying he would buy my meal next time but I won't be back.

I want to start out this review by saying - I am never going back to Moto.   I went there one time with a group. I was excited to try a new sushi place and normally really love sushi. However, there was a really bad odor when I walked in so I opted against trying the fish there out of fear of food poisoning. I can't comment on how the sushi is at Moto. Instead, I decided to try the Pho. I have eaten Pho at many places around town and typically enjoy it. Not at Moto. The broth was a darker color than I am used to and had a funny after taste. I couldn't even get through about 1/4 of it before I lost my appetite.   Most of the other members of my group didn't like the food much either. My advice is that there are too many other places near Moto for good sushi and pho to risk trying this place.

The Moto Chicken Salad is delicious.  The smaller size is huge and will happily fill you up for the rest of the day.  However, the best thing about this local neighborhood restaurant is a waitress named Jenny.  We always try to get her as our waitress.  She goes above and beyond to make sure that you have everything you need, and she is so upbeat and sweet that even if your day hasn't been going that well, you feel better!    I actually prefer to go during the week rather than on Saturday, but then I don't care about the all you can eat sushi.
THE WORST...That's all I can say. Tried Spicy Tuna, Philly, chicken wings, chow mien. It was all really bad. Horrible.

Call ahead and make sure Vince - the owner - is there.  When he's not, the place totally falls apart.  It's like having a substitute teacher in a fourth grade class when Vince isn't there.  The servers don't care and get snooty and food comes out at various times.  I think this is a result of Vince being an active owner/manager.  The problem is that he doesn't have a solid manager to back him up when he's gone.  Someone else needs to be able to crack the whip.    I'm a regular and will continue to be so, but my trips to Moto are few and far between when Vince isn't there driving his tatted-up sushi and saki slinging serving staff.

We went here for a late lunch (around 2.30pm on black friday) which is a slow time. Only us and a few more people in the restaurant. We're big sushi fiends and the selection here was mediocre - through the quality of what they had was great. Desert mochi was scrumptious and the rolls.we tried instead of the sashimi variety were also great.

We have been loyal customers of Moto for years.  Unfortunately, the services is inconsistent.  Tonight, our sushi for 3 people took over an hour and 10 minutes to get.  After ordering, the waitress completely ignored us, until we started asking about our food after 50 minutes of waiting.  She kept telling us one more minute... for 20 minutes.  Before our food arrived, we asked for the bill to cancel our order.  She talked us into staying and we did because of our loyalty to this place.  Eventually the food came with a hair in the sushi that we tried to ignore.  After receiving and paying the full price for our food, we asked to speak to a manager.  We were told things were busy and that they hope they see us again.  So in summary it has good food if you're willing to wait forever in a moderately full restaurant to get served.

Not too many sushi choices in the area. Visited a month ago. Place was kinda busy, but our rolls came out pretty quick. Everything was fresh and overall service was good. I would give it another chance.

I go to this restaurant all the time and love the lunch bowls, moto chicken salad and sushi.  Location is great, atmoshpere is okay recommend if you are in the area to check it out.  Sometimes there can be a short wait but it is worth it!

So sad, this use to be our favorite place. We would eat there at least once a week for the last year. Charitys service never wavered, it was always top notch. The food quality has been so bad the last 3 weeks that this was our last trip there. Sincerely Mustered Gas wings and tofu pho couple.
Inventive.. Rice a bit on the over sticky side on the rolls but great service.  Must try the nachos and great happy hour!!!

Having not been to Moto in a couple of years, my girlfriend Karen an I recently made a return visit specifically for the all-you-can-eat sushi special. The first thing I noticed was that my favorite, eel nigiri, was replaced by smoked salmon on the all-you-can eat menu; strike one. Despite this, we both ordered the special. I opted for the additional sake bomber while Karen had a bottle of Sapporo. Now, the sushi was never spectacular in past visits, but the price was reasonable for the limited selection. But it was hard to reconcile the three dollar increase since our last visit;strike two. On a positive note the smoked salmon nigiri was actually VERY good. Unfortunately, that was the ONLY positive to this experience. The server was attentive enough though we felt rushed (we didn't reorder anything). When I got the check, I discovered that A)While I was only charged an additional three dollars for the sake bomber (22oz. Sapporo and a small sake), I was charged the full $5.00 for Karen's lone 22oz Sapporo. B)There was a 20% gratuity included in the bill.(I don't know if it was policy or the server was feeling especially generous with my money):strike three. I did not raise the issue with the check because we didn't really miss the two bucks though Karen might have liked to have had the sake also, And I would've tipped 20% anyway as is usually my practice when I receive adequate service though it is very presumptuous to automatically assume we received adequate service. Ultimately, there are too many other places where we can go to get adequate sushi and adequate service without being milked for an extra few bucks. Therefore we will not be returning to Moto as it is no longer in competition for our dining dollars.
great location and good service..food is good...but I am not a huge sushi lover so there you go

I enjoyed this place for lunch.....   The likes:  The humorous menu and helpful staff.....  Nice portions, the Miso soup is excellent and large.  The edamame was adequate and fresh.  My lunchmate had the Vegas roll which was good but not the best in town by a long shot (think Hana and Dozo)  The dislikes:  I ordered the katsu...   This is a sticking point with me as few or no restaurants in the US seem to serve this properly.  The Katsu was goos but tasted like a generic chicken cutlet.  Panko should be VERY crispy and tasty this was not.  The appropriate accompniament is always white rise (check!) and shredded cabbage.  There seems to be the temptation to eliminate or modify this in the US.  Bad Idea!  While the "Asian Slaw" is tasty  it dominates the plate in a not so good way.  The Tea - Dammit! why do place have to serve such crappy tea!  It is an inexpensive way to complement a meal.  We got an ancient teabag with genmaicha in it served uncermonioously   The Service - Come her with lots of time the service was inattentive and sporadic.  When she was there it was great it was the 20 minute absence that killed the deal  I will go back for the AYCE buffet and try the sushi...

Food was good, service was lousy. Started out with Edemame and Gyoza. Both were good. Had a mix of nigiri (yellowtail, tuna, salmon, and eel) plus some rolls. All were good.  Alas, food is only half the battle. The service was bad. The table next to us was left dirty for our entire meal. We started adding plates to the mess because our used plates were never picked up. Also, took about 20 minutes to get the check.   Not sure I would return.

Food provided nourishment but the experience left something to be desired.    We had gone to this place for years because of business on this end of town.  The food was always good but the service was nothing to brag about.    We no longer come to this side of town, so never returned.  However, we found ourselves unexpectedly here and the service once again fell short.    I asked for no ranch on my dinner, it took three attempts to get it right.  Our server disappeared for at least 15 minutes while I sat with an empty beer and watched my wife eat her dinner.  My wife finished and I still had no plate.  At this point, I'm ready to leave.  I approached the hostess to find out what happened to our server.  Guess what, my food all of the sudden showed up.  I asked for the manager, our server said no problem.  The manager did not show up but our server came back offering 5% off the bill.  I just found it offensive.  Just acknowledge instead of pretending someone shouldn't be unhappy.  I go out to dinner for an experience, not annoyance.    It's been my experience that this restaurant is never packed, just every other table.  Just an average experience where you have to voice dissatisfaction if you have it because it's not presumed when it's a gross shortfall.  Most people hate complaining, why make them.  I wished I never said anything and just moved on.  McDonalds was just across the street.    It's not the first time an order has been screwed up, eat out enough it's gonna happen.  Generally not a big deal, crap happens, there's just better ways to handle it.  Like "I'm sorry."

My first time here, my friend and I both got the ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI which is Saturday 11-2:30pm. These are for rolls and nigiri, and there are rules - NO RICISM. Eat your rice. Anyway, the rolls were scrumptious, and the Las Vegas roll was a delicious departure from the norm. We started big, ordering 3 rolls each, then 3 more I think. Order what you can eat, OK? Don't be wasteful. You'll see the rules on the placard. *** $4 auto-tip added for all you can eat per person. ***   Another time I came here for my friend's b-day and the girlfriend treated several of us with URGING to consume. We all ordered a variety of rolls and we all shared many pieces of each. I felt guilty, but I couldn't get enough of the smoked salmon sashimi at $9.99 each. The presentation was beautiful - it was made to look like a rose on the plate.  The flavor and texture made me fall in love with each mouthful.  I had flashbacks of kissing Reanna, my old GF in the 90's. HHMMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmmmm.  *snaps awake* Oh and good beers too! Service was courteous and attentive.

So I've been to this place twice. The first time, it was super-awesome, and I love, love, love the divine desert sushi...hello?! Rice Krispy treats and ice cream? To die for. I started with the curry soup, quite good, with just a hint of spice. The sushi served was fresh and the portions (especially the sashimi) were quite large. My first experience at Moto? Overall excellent.  Sadly, on my second visit, I encountered a hot restaurant (eeew, raw fish and a hot environment?) with mediocre service. We arrived at 12:30 and attempted the All You Can Eat Sushi, two full hours later we had eaten exactly about two rolls and two nigiris each. minus soy sauce for the first order since we never got our soy sauce bowls. We were told the AYCES would take about 15 minutes to prepare when in actuality it took just under an hour for each order.   We watched as two different families sat at a table across from us and left after waiting for about 10 minutes to give a drink order, nobody ever came.    Finally, this little grandpa with his two grandsons came in they, like us waited and waited. the grandfather told the server he felt he had been waiting too long (45 minutes), she offered an apology and sent the manager over who began to actually argue with the man, she actually asked if he had ever eaten at a sushi place before.  Excuse me? Not professional.  Then tried to tell him that the server had placed his order only 20 minutes earlier. He was confused as he had ordered a good 40-45 minutes earlier.  The manager, again, argued with the man telling him he didn't order 45 minutes earlier.    Bottom line: AYCES is horrible, we actually overheard the manager tell the man "The AYCES is prepared AFTER other regular orders, regardless of when placed, so that customers who order order off the regular menu get their food hot." Really? So the sushi chefs are also in the kitchen preparing soups and noodle dishes? Not likely.  So, take the 18 bucks, add on the automatic 20% gratuity and you've got yourself a meal a little over 20 bucks a piece and you've only eaten 5 pieces of sushi.    I will not return for AYCES, but for a dinner? Sure thing.

Sushi is okay but a little over priced.   Service isn't the best either.  They have had Fox News on every time I have been there, which no one under 60 years old wants to watch while eating.  Not great.

One of my favorite local sushi places. They have a huge menu so even if you don't like sushi you'll probably find something else delicious to eat. The staff is very friendly. Get the dessert sushi!! It's so good!!

Hands down my favorite place to get sushi in the valley without breaking the bank. But wait, what if you don't want sushi? They have something for everyone. My friend says the burger is delicious, but me, I'm here for the underground sushi.   Pro tips: go during happy hour, 3 to 6:15 Monday through Friday and all day Sunday. Also sit at the bar, the bartenders are more attentive than the girls working the floor.

Yo! I found a new awesome hidden sushi place to Yelp about!!!!  Wait, three people have already Yelped it.   And apparently it's been open for 2 years already.   Never mind.  In any case, the first time I ever noticed Moto was some weeks ago as I stepped out of Basha's - a Basha's I never go to either since I almost always take AZ-51 home after work. But somehow that day I decided to take 16th St all the way down and Moto caught my eye, although I had no idea what it was still.   Fast forward to today, another day I decide to randomly drive down 16th St.  And I hit Glendale Ave.  As I wait at the light, I think. Now, I don't think too often, but for some reason today, I did. And I thought "There's that Moto again. What's its deal?"  And so I pulled into the Basha's lot, parked and walked up. A nice crossed out McDonald's golden arches symbol greets you as approach the door, which kicks ass considering McDonald's is in the same parking lot.   I knew I was going to like this place already, even though I still didn't know what the hell it was. "Go Your Own Way" by Fleetwood Mac was blaring from the speakers. Was this a biker bar? A car-themed burger joint?  Only one way to find out.  In I went, and a cool, contemporary restaurant layout was in front of me, with a bar full of good stuff beckoning. I decided today that I was going to sit at said bar, which was the best thing I could have done - I engaged in conversation with the server and the sushi chef the entire time and got the lowdown of the place.  Moto used to be a Shogun Express once upon a time, but the owner of the chain wanted to do something a notch higher and sold all the Shoguns and turned this location into Moto. The menu is eclectic and witty, offering a variety of rice bowls and sushi, along with buffalo burgers and "sushi ice cream" for dessert (a great concept called Mojos, where ice cream and brownie are rolled in a layer of rice krispies and then sliced like sushi and served in a bowl). They have a generous happy hour menu and All You Can Eat Saturdays from 11am-2:30pm.   I asked them how business was going and they said it's been really good, and it has become a local hangout full of regulars in north central Phoenix, which is awesome. I appreciate that this part of town has some great places like this and not just stuck with Panda Express (or even Shogun Express for that matter).   As for the food, I wasn't feeling particularly hungry so I just got unagi (eel) nigiri and an 8 piece spicy hamachi (yellowtail) roll. I'd say they were pretty well done, and although I thought Hana's sushi was better in the quality of the fish as well as presentation (he's not called Mr. Sushi Rock Star for nothing), for the price and also the taste I thought what I had here at Moto was still an awesome deal. I scored both orders plus a large Kirin Light (which came with a frosted 1.5 pint glass) for $12. Not bad. Not bad at all.  The fact that there was no pretentiousness at all here and that the servers and sushi chef were really friendly to a random confused guy dressed in his dorky office clothes, I give them high marks. Definitely another place to come back with friends (and also to partake in All You Can Eat Saturdays - you can bet your ass I'm there!).   4 stars.
Great place. Cheri, Marie, Nancy, Ivan, Fili, are all great people and provide top notch service. Love the food, eat there every Saturday. Give it a try you'll like it.

I've had better sushi elsewhere.  The service is what is worst.  When I've ordered, it's usually over lunch and I don't have time to dine in so I order ahead and pick up.  I've done this three times.  Don't ask me why, I guess I just like giving people lots of chances or something, unless they royally screw up the first time.  Each time I've gone in, I have to wait at the register and am completely ignored by EVERYONE who works there, even though they are standing right in front of me.  I'm not a picky or overbearing person who is prone to exagerration either.  I've waited tables before, I know you should at least greet someone and tell them you'll be right with them no matter how swamped you are.  Each time, they always forget the sauce that goes with one of the sushi rolls, and when I ask them (because I know they forgot), they act annoyed, check the bag- lo and behold, it's not there and they have to put it in.  Anyway, if the service were better I'd give it a better rating.  The sushi is just okay.  Maybe their other stuff is better.  The service bites.  Did I happen to mention the service could use some improvement?  ;)

I find myself craving Moto and wishing I could go back for that Saturday All You Can Eat special. I live 15 minutes from the ocean now and haven't been impressed yet with any other business as far as service, price and quality goes. Together my friend and I ordered Tootsie Roll x2, Alaska Roll x2, Vegas roll and Veggie roll and all were VERY good.   Our waitress was very attentive and cheery, she even let us take home our leftovers (we over-ordered by an entire roll, didn't realize how stuffed we would get!) which is usually not allowed during AYCE, so thanks for that!  The initial wait time was about 20-25 minutes, but it was worth it and the orders after were very quick. I also want to note that they serve a delicious grapefruit-flavored beer called Pink Killer, which was very complimentary to our sushi rolls. When we asked where we may be able to find it outside of Moto, the waitress asked the manager who actually came out to our table to tell us about it. Very appreciated!

The food as a whole is just average. The sushi is a bit below average. It falls in the "not bad, but not good category". I have not tried everything on the menu but one thing that is good is the Curry Soup. It is very spicy and has a great flavor. It is just not very filling, more or less soup with about a 1/2 cup of rice and a bit of crab meat. A bit pricey at $5.75. All the portions are very small and over priced. Come here for the drinks, to eat a bit, and hang out with friends but not if you are looking for great food.

$11 Vegas roll.. Krab, Smoked salmon, cream cheese and avocado.. First two pieces had nothing but rice.. There was a little sliver of avocado in the last two pieces.. As someone who has served sushi at a different restaurant, this is just laziness and under portioning by the sushi chefs.. Calamari was also undercooked, a mixture of soggy and rubbery.

I've been to Moto several times as it's right down the street from me, and it's my go-to when I want average sushi and a Happy Hour drink. The servers are friendly and the menu is really varied; I always question establishments that serve such a stark variation in cuisine, but this place manages to competently serve everything from sushi to stir frys to burgers and sweet potato fries.   I use the term "competently" because it's by no means great food. The sushi is average, at best, but I come back because they have a good happy hour and the ambiance is way better than at your average Japanese restaurant. This place is obviously not authentic Japanese food as you quickly learn from taking a glance at their amusing menu, but I don't mind a little lack of authenticity for the sake of a more comfortable and fun environment.   My one significant gripe is that they market themselves as a sushi restaurant but the menu appears to be lacking in the most basic rolls; I usually try to order off-menu standards when I'm there like a simple tuna or yellowtail roll and they're usually accommodating. I asked for a regular salmon roll once though, and was told that they only have the smoked salmon that comes in the Philly Roll. A sushi restaurant that doesn't carry raw salmon?! You've got to be kidding me, I hope that my server was just uninformed because that's pretty inexcusable otherwise.   I wouldn't suggest coming here for sushi except during Happy Hour, because their sushi isn't very good and so it's overpriced if you go during regular times.

I came here during happy hour for sushi. We ordered the calamari first, which was pretty good. It had a tasty dipping sauce with it. We ordered a rainbow roll and a las vegas roll. These two were quite unimpressive. There was little flavor and I was starting to doubt the quality of the fish.  Then I ordered the Sasquatch roll, which was really great. The flavors were delicious and I was quite impressed. However, this is the only roll that I would order again. Seems like the happy hour sushi is the cheap stuff. I would stick to the regular menu.

Moto is where I really got hooked on sushi, though what I have had off of the rest of the menu is always yummy too. The sushi is always fresh and the sweet potato fries are a great side to share with the table. I recommend Moto Happy Hour to friends all the time for sushi on a budget - the California, Spicy Tuna and Spicy Yellowtail rolls are all half-price and you can grab a 20oz beer for $3.50 to wash it all down. The "underground menu" is also a great option when your feeling flush - the rolls are all $12 each. My favorites are the volcano roll when I want something spicy and the mayflower roll when I want something bright and fresh. YUM!  My only complaint (besides the Fox news that is always on the television sets) is that they don't usually have the Ace Pear cider on tap like they used to... my non-beer drinking friends always appreciated the option and it was a favorite of mine as well.  UPDATE: the underground menu is above ground now - printed and pricey! The happy hour is still worthwhile and the beer list always has decent craft options (although they still lack a consistent cider for those who enjoy it and tend towards primarily hoppy beer choices). We still love the place and as we prepared to move cross-country, it was one of the few spots my husband needed to visit before saying goodbye for a year.

I have held off writing a review for Moto for a year or so.  Sadly I have been subject to dining here multiple times, because I am sucker for 'second chances...and third and fourth'...  Moto joined the North Central scene years ago, and sadly has gone down hill.  The only thing helping it stay afloat is the lack of other sushi restaurants in the area for the citizens of the neighborhood to enjoy.    The service is pitiful, and it seems like they hire anyone that inquires.  Dining at Moto takes over an hour and a half, with just 3 people.  Getting water upon arrival is painful and receiving the exact food you ordered, is not an option.   Whatever you do...don't come to dine if you have any food allergy.   The bartenders are always eating and licking their fingers, touching their hair and then touching everything "sanitary" behind the bar.  The drinks made and ready to go to their respectful customers, just sit at the bar back and begin to water down for easily 10 mins before the floor server magically reappears from the kitchen.  The food isnt even good!  Sushi is sloppy, not creative, and poor cuts of fish.    The ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI...well, they bank on their horrible service to never bring you the goods as you request and are ready.  We sat in front of empty plates for 35 mins at one point.  Twice now, when we were ready to leave, the server is no where to be found (just the same as most of the meal).  I was literally trying to give them money and they would avoid all eye contact and assistance. *que bad SNL skit from the 80s....   Please, do yourself a favor, and do not dine here....and WHATEVER you do...dont take anyone here for dinner, you will embarrass yourself.

I traveled to Phoenix regularly and every time I am in town, I make it a point to have dinner at Moto. They have a great selection of draft beers, their Pad Thai is one of the best I've ever had, but the standout menu item is the curry soup - it's the best!  If you're looking for a great Asian fusion meal with great service at a quaint restaurant, goto Moto!
I liked the food! Ordered grilled salmon and a side salad. Both wear great! The ginger dressing on the salad was really good. I will come back.

man after reading some of the reviews I must of went on the greatest day of the year because everything was fantastic well I did not have sushi  i had a Asian qesadea it was good lots of chicken and a little spicy and the dipping sauce was really good the wings were breaded witch I didn't normally like but  these ones  I highly recommend  crispy and juicy  get there mustard gas sauce for the wings I just wanted to drink it hot and sweet  can't beat it  the Tonia salad was amazing so much chicken it had a lite breading  just right amount of acidity for the dressing but I add a little but of the mustard gas wing sauce to mine to spice it up man so good wife and the pho noodles that was good. it  wasn't  as good as mine our sever was grate went over the menu drinks got filled all the time didn't ever need to ask for anything and I find there signs funny people need to stop taking it personal I will be back very soon
I love this place. Happy hour is 50% off selected items but those are delicious. Try the Asian Nachos.

This place caught my eye because of it's fun, trendy atmosphere vibe and the sassy menu (check it out online - you'll see what I mean) made me think this place was worth trying. What better time to try it then on a fun date night with the fiance?  Well, it's definitely got the fun, trendy atmosphere and yep, the menu is still amusingly sassy and clever. As for the food, well...the sushi is....decent. I believe another earlier yelper described it perfectly as "passable." Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad in any way it just wasn't as good as other sushi I've had. My fiance and I ordered three rolls between the two of us and we felt that it was mostly rice, not enough fish and not enough flavor. The spicy tuna was just not spicy enough for me - not enough sriracha in my opinion - but that's just me. Overall, our stomachs left Moto Sushi satisfied from hunger but not overly excited about anything else.   Plus, I have to share that I had my most strange sushi restaurant experience while at Moto when the couple on a date at the table next to ours loudly proclaimed that they hate seafood and proceeded to order buffalo chicken wings - which they then ate with chopsticks - just baffled me.  It must be the combination of the sushi and the customers but I just didn't feel like I was in the right place for a great Japanese dinner. It almost felt like it was a restaurant that just happened to serve sushi but everything else about the place doesn't match. It just felt....off. It may be worth going back just to see what else is on their clever, sassy menu but only if we happen to be in the area.

*** Edited on April 13, 2008 to add this new bad experience. I'm thinking about changing my rating to ONE STAR because the experience.  Went to Moto at 9:35 PM on Sat April 13 April night. Sign states they close at 10 PM. Waitress and Host made us stand in doorway like dicks while they "decide" if they are still "open."   They hem and haw and "say hold on." I asked what time they stop seating and they said "10:00 PM." I ask them what time it is. Instead of answering me directly, the waitress says "fine, we'll seat you." We start to walk to the table and she adds "but you have to order fast."  FUCK THAT!  So I tell her, "thanks but no thank you" and leave.  That was Saturday night.  ORIGINAL REVIEW: I'll start backwards, at the end of my experience. The dessert is fricking awesome! The rice crispy sushi roll ice cream thing is out of this world. Holy goodness it's yummy.  They also offer a nice selection of beer and the drink menu is diverse. The sake selection is not so great, but they do offer fun mixed drinks to make up for it.  As for the food - I would give it a B+. Maybe A-. The Asian nachos app. was actually pretty interesting (in a good way). The sushi was pretty good too. Not the best, but good.   Our server was a little strange. We couldn't decide if she was a little rude or just ditzy. But the host/door guy was great so at least we know they are capable of decent service.  Moto is a pretty solid place. I kind of wish it were downtown Phoenix rather than so far up north, but I guess a girl can't have everything she wants, right?  I'll be back to Moto soon, for sure. but the service needs much improvment.

The food is fresh - the lunch bowls are so customizable that nobody can really have an excuse to leave hungry or unhappy.    The service is prompt and unfussy, this place knows its business and its customers and does a great job of lunch.   The parking lot is gruesome, but that can't be helped on this corner. If I didn't have a 35 mile commute, this would be a happy hour goto for sure.

The pad Thai noodles is AMAZING!!! My boyfriend took me on a date here, and I was worried I wouldn't be able to find anything good to eat because I don't like sushi. Fortunately, they have Pad Thai noodles that tastes great! Also, they have great beer! Go go go!

This is a great little Asian fusion joint! One side of the menu is primarily sushi the other fusion (Chinese, Vietnamese,  Thai ) The lemon grass pork was perfect balance of sweet, citus, and spice with nice cuts of pork. Sweet potato fries had just enough crunch and salt to make for a party in my mouth. Seaweed salad was generous and delightfully crunchy and not over sweet. They also happened to have a German NA beer I'd never seen before that was quite delicious.  They have plenty of alcohol,  but not being a drinker I couldn't tell you anything about it! One of my favorite parts of this place is the music...a great mix of rocking grooves from 60s-80s, but without being the repetitive "greatest hits" you hear over and over on classic rock stations...and kind of an old timey diner feel...on an end note, my niece is not an adventurous eater and she loves this place. When we were there last her food came with a garnish she's allergic to and they fixed it up without a fuss. After I asked about gf they were very consciousness about informing me of how various dishes were prepared. ***update : I went here a number of times while I was in phx and there was a steady decline from my initial awesome experience.  Food quality was pretty steady with the exception of some soggy, doused in sugar sweet potato fries. Service was very poor by the end...one time i didn't receive all of my change, one another continuously forgotten items throughout the meal, including bringing the appetizer at the end of the meal...when asked to take it off the tab since it was covered in the sauce we asked to not have since it was an allergen, they declined but brought us a freshly made one...I guess we can be grateful they didn't just scrape off the death-on-a-plate and bring it back.

You gotta try this place for sushi and ask for the underground menu!!  and save room for dessert, try their ice cream rolls!  My little picky sister who doesn't eat fish loves this place and she will actually eat sushi here.  Try the "volcano roll" its very tasty.  Their salads, rice and noodle bowls are awesome too.

Wow, pretty impressed. We tried to go to another restaurant in the area, but the wait was too long. I'm glad wifey remembered about this place. The parking lot is NUTS, but we lucked out and got a good spot. we were able to get seated immediately, which is ALWAYS a bonus! We started with the Asian Nachos $($7.95). There were good, but not my thing. I ordered the Sasquatch roll that had crab, shrimp tempura, scallop, avocado and this orange mayo, that was KILLER! ($12.95). Wifey got the Las Vegas Roll ($9.95) that had crab, cream cheese and shrimp and it was fried. Again, a great roll. I also ordered the spicy ribs. They were sauceless and SUPER crispy!!! I was expecting more grilled ribs (like my fave at Sochu House) but there were VERY good. And as a bonus, the server brought my wife and I a shot (I had both because she was driving) because she noticed my 5 year old kinda being a hand full and thought we could use it to unwind! How awesome is THAT? All in all, great food and super perfect service. I'll definitely be coming back!

love love moto fresh fish cool atmosphere must try this hip mod place.  The noodles are out of this world and the sushi is the best in this part of town. Be prepared for a long wait this place is popular.
Love this place great service great food and a lot of fun. It like my cheers bar. I will always dine at this place.

My family comes here at least twice a week. I moved out of town and they use to tell me when they were going out to dinner to make me jealous  I miss Moto so much. The service is awesome. The food is authentic. Every time I go to a sushi place I compare it and I never get the results I get at Moto. Honestly, beautiful service, people and food. Ask for charity. She gives best service, best drinks and genuine personality. It's obvious why she has been there for so long.

I had a hankering for raw fish today and decided to give Moto a try.  Overall I was pleased.  The menu had a wide variety of tempting Asian treats but I was here for fish, so I ordered the sashimi combo with a bowl of Miso.  The soup was a bit odd.  It seemed to be normal Miso soup with some shredded cabbage tossed in.  The cabbage added a texture that I didn't really want but it was easy to eat around it.  The presentation of the sashimi was interesting.  I had a pinwheel of fishy goodness with yellowtail, smoked salmon and tuna.  The fish tasted quite fresh and the portions were generous.  When I need a sushi fix for lunch I'll be returning to Moto.

This is my favorite Phoenix sushi restaurant. I admit I mostly get the same items every time and out of the probably hundreds of times I've eaten here I've only had less than great food a couple times. They have vegetarian items too and most things can be ordered with tofu instead of chicken or beef ( the noodle bowls and Asian nachos). They also have an all you can eat sushi special on Saturdays I believe. Oh and you must try the mojos - they are a dessert item and to die for!  I order off the underground menu and it states that since they're specialty items it may take longer to make which is fine for me because I usually order to go anyway and the times I don't I order one of the craft beers on the constantly changing beer menu - I do love experimenting with the beers from different places.  There are a lot of regulars - smiling faces - and there are TVs playing the current games at the bar, very low key laid back vibe, I love it.  I will say it is much harder to get parking since Sprouts moved into the area but that's the only downside.

The menu here cracks me up, it has little comments on the decor, innuendos, recommendations / warnings (there is a stoner bowl and an exit wound bowl).  This is what fusion SHOULD be.  The smoked salmon sashimi is presented as a rose, their rainbow roll melts in your mouth. I love the spicy red curry coconut crab bisque. They have these Asian nachos, they're crispy wantons with all the stuff you'd expect on nachos. I drowned my sorrows from ending a ltr in these nachos, and those nachos worked.

I love this restaurant and have experienced very few challenges here. I have been going to moto for several years. The happy hour is AMAZING! When it's me and a friend, we walk out with a $15+tip bill and full bellies.. The food is great. I get the same thing almost every time I go in. The nachos are TO DIE FOR! I would also suggest the tootsie roll and gyoza (crispy). When I'm with my dad (and he is paying! :P) we order the Moto Chicken Salad-- so great! I eat here at least 2 times a month if not more. The waitresses are always friendly. Today we were in a hurry but really wanted happy hour sushi so they let us call our order in ahead (as you have to dine in for happy hour prices). We made it there in about 10 minutes and they had a table set up for us complete with waters and all of our food ready to eat! It absolutely made our day.
We love Moto! We are frequent visitors, and love the atmosphere as well as the sushi! It's a must try!
Love the atmosphere, sushi is great with a lot to offer on the menu. The waitresses are very friends and the service is always fantastic!

I do have to agree with the other comments that the service is not the best.  I did not see any sobbing waitresses but it did take a while to get our food.  The fried calamari were very good, actually cooked perfect and not rubbery at all!  The Vegas roll did have crab in it which threw me off a little but was still good.  The tootsie rool was also very good!   Great Happy Hour prices...
This is one of the top sushi places I have been to in the entire vally. The sushi chef even says he does private parties. Take a look at the catipillar roll picture I posted! Amazing...
My go to spot for some great Asian inspired cuisine. Try the shrimp curry soup, the 4 step entree bowl, and get a craft beer and enjoy the unique atmosphere.

Nothing too special about Moto Sushi outside of their sushi desert which consists of ice cream, nutella, and brownie rolled into a layer of rice krispies and sliced "like sushi."  That might be the only thing sushi about it...because it's "sliced like sushi."  If I sliced a crawfish into sushi roll shapes, would I be able to market it sliced "like sushi"?  It was a fun end of the meal treat.  Outside of that unique desert experience, their sushi was just so so.  The waitress had a "secret menu" that she did not even inform us until we had got our order.  My co worker then proceeded to order another roll after we found out about this secret menu.  I'm not sure what is the point of the secret menu if they don't show it to you until you after you receive your food.  What's the point?

One of my favorite sushi hangouts. Themed around motorcycle environment, Vince the owner has a great flare for combining Asian influences for delicious menu. Great appetizers, I suggest the Asian nachos. A must try is the desert, ice cream sushi. Different flavored each week it brings out the child in every adult.

So - started working right down the road from MOTO, and a coworker said, there's a good lunch spot down the road, we should go.  So we did.  I really, really like this place.  It's got a hip, yet laid back atmosphere, good rock music playing, and very genuine and friendly staff.    Food - I've had sushi here a few times, and it was "good".  About 7.5/10 on my sushi scale.  But let's talk about their build to order rice bowls.  You can mix and match a myriad of meats and vegetables and choose your temperature level.  I told my server a few visits ago that I really like hot, spicy food, and she recommended the "Exit Wound" bowl.  The name alone is super cool.  This selection immediately became my favorite lunch dish that I've had in ages.  Quite spicy, but not over the top....and amazing flavor sauteed into the breaded shrimp, chicken and fresh vegetables, all over white or brown rice.  (brown for me)  Did I mention that the owner of this place is a beer snob?  There are always several outstanding craft brews on tap here - and they go SO well with some of the spicier dishes.  I would come to MOTO just for the beer selections, but the food is also good enough to get me back in there as well.  I now visit Moto at least once a week for lunch, and they haven't let me down yet.  Love this joint - 5 stars - and get the Exit Wound bowl!!

I've been in and out of this place for the last 2-3 years since I work so close to it and little has changed. Well,  everything except for the staff who may as well change every other week explaining a lot about the service or lack thereof.  Moto is run by both pretentious and puerile people who make the tragic mistake of thinking that they are either clever or fun. They are neither. Their menu is only half as ridiculous as their thinly veiled tantrums between employees about customers and co-workers. Well, depending on which menu you get, because a lot of their best puerile antics are in the phenomenally stupid act of hiding their food from their customers.   No joke, any one menu you see is incomplete because you have to get their "secret" menus to see what they really have. Often these same menus are woefully inaccurate anyway making any one menu pretty useless overall. You may as well cross your fingers when you order. My eyes rolled so hard they nearly popped out of my head when the staff explained this fun gimmick to me.  They burn through waiting staff like the place has a revolving door, so an all-too frequent sight is a woman sobbing her eyes out just outside the building because she got fired. Sometimes, if you're lucky, the boss will be out hollering at them making it even more attractive. Yeah, I want to eat THERE; where the women cry.  For the record, these guys bought a closed Japanese fast food restaurant (Formerly a Shogun Express), peeled off all the surfaces and then painted bricks red as they broke the lights making it incredibly dim to give it that east coast "this place is condemned, but eat here anyway" sort of look and feel.   You know what they say about eating in a low-lit environment, right? The prices are roughly on par with the vastly superior RA Sushi restaurant, but because they're both pretentious and puerile they will arbitrarily decide to tack on gratuity at a whim as well as various "taxes" to punish customers.   I'm not kidding. I observed a guy who got hit with a "Geek Tax" for bringing in his child holding a McDonald's cup, he was less than happy for the remarkle expense for a bowl of Chicken. I asked about it later and they explained that they fine people for various reasons and sneak it onto their bills.  It's not a great place to spend time, but since you'll be waiting FOREVER for food or drink refills anyway, you'll also come to embrace the ugly, uncomfortable furniture, which is meant to compel you to leave. So it's ironic that everything takes so long.  The food is schizophrenic in its spastic variety and its minuscule sushi portions and variety (and stupid list of in-restaurant rules) are pathetic. The management is barking mad, the servers can't juggle tables and the prices are as reliable as the unreliable menus.  If you MUST try this place, try to do the take-out service if possible. It's the only way not to be disappointed. Eat in at your own risk. I don't drink so I can't speak for their alcohol, but I hear their beer selection isn't bad.

We are generally big fans of Moto Sushi but today was not a good experience (unfortunately).  We waited for 40 minutes for take out food (2 Moto salads) and it was clear that there was a staffing/management issue.  The person at the desk never came out proactively to explain the delay and I had to go back up three times to get better attention to the order.  To make matters worse, the food was not good which is highly unusual but nevertheless very disappointing.  I assume the inferior quality of the outcome (food) was a result of trying to rush the meal preparation after alerting management 3X that I had been waiting for an unusually long time.  I hope this experience is an anomaly but for now, I will be gun shy to come back any time soon.  All the best!

Been back a few more times, and I'm beginning to discover that when I don't order sushi at this sushi place, I enjoy my meal a lot more.  Wings, nachos and quesadilla are all unique dishes that work. Sushi is still OK, but I don't see us ordering rolls much in the future when they have such awesome dishes elsewhere on the menu.  I retract my previous comment about HH beers. I've noticed they heavily rotate their beer list for happy hour, which I love. A lot of the stuff on offer I have never heard of. Very strong beer list, check it out. Impressive.  Service is consistently very good, too. Definitely an all star team. Attentive and friendly every time, can't find that very often nowadays. Prices are reasonable, too.   Definitely in my regular rotation for the foreseeable future.
Fantastic find today! Great food, amazing beer on tap, and superb service. Sushi made to order and very helpful knowledgeable workers. Can't wait to come back for the hospitality and delicious food.
Love this local sushi spot. A must try in central Phoenix! They have a great selection on the menu! The fish is very fresh. You can spot me there at least once a week!

Great place to hang out fir friends! Friendly staff, creative food, and craft beers that I never heard of, but always willing to try.  The staff is knowledgable about the beer and the food and seem to care and take interest in their customers.  Stop in for happy hour, lunch or dinner!

I always use to eat there when I would get sick and tired of eating the junk at McDonald's (where I use to work at. At the time) and I moved to Las Vegas and always wonder if they stayed in business, I'm glad they still are because I love their rice bowls. They are good. I can't think of the name right now but ugh. It's so good. It burns your mouth but it's a good burn. I hope this place stays open decades and decades to come.

Great neighborhood restaurant. Most times the entrees are on point! Only when it's super busy that a mistake could happen...we're all human. Awesome beers on tap! Love the banner and I'm Asian for saying this...just lighten the fuck up people! He's married to a wonder, strong, successful asian lady!

The cool kids in the office like Moto, I want to like Moto.  Lots of Yelp'ers don't like Moto... Oh, that's what those bad reviews were talking about...  Great ideas and recipes with inconsistent execution.  They burned my wings. Look at the picture (if you can).  I thought it was sauce... nope.  They are overcooked.  I am clumsy so I always ask for extra napkins...when I can.  After I completely use my own waiting for a chance to ask, I lean over and take some off the neighboring table.  To be fair there were some cool people there, so I guess my waitress had better things to do.    This place could be five stars if they fix the service and cooking (That sounded like a complement in my head).  What I mean to say is Moto has a good vibe and a great menu.  Maybe next time...

This sushi place has been a favorite for sometime. They are decent with  prices and ambiance. The food is good, one of the best squid salads in town!. There happy hour sushi menu has a few regular pieces, like california role; i think i would like to see more of a selection in the future.

Ordered food for pick up during my lunch hour and they said ready in 30 min. I arrived 30 min later at and had to wait until 11:55!  They could have at least offered me a drink of water after I wasted my lunch waiting. All to receive a tiny peace of salmon in my very dissapointing salmon bowl .

I SENT THE FOLLOWING TO THE MANAGEMENT AT MOTO ON JULY 17.  Good morning:  People I work with had raved about MOTO, and since I had moved to the downtown area, were eager to show it to me, although each had admitted to not having been there in a while. I was excited to find a decent sushi joint as I now live 3 minutes away and appreciated an introduction to someplace where I would thereafter go on my own to enjoy the sushi bar after work as my local.   I visited on July 5th and met one of my friends who had been seated at the tiniest two-top around the corner from the service area in the seated dining area which had only 2 other occupants. I asked to move to a window table in preparation for the  sushi all you can eat experience.  She ordered two of the rolls and I had 3 of the nigiri  on offer. The rice was so loose I couldn't pick it up even with fingers without everything scattering.  For someplace that madates YOU MUST EAT THE RICE, the chef didn't make that easy.
