I would have expected nominal seasoning with the vinegar in the rice or a small bit of wasabi between fish and rice but this didn't have any, which may be MOTO syle,  but with the rice being so loose, I couldn't easily put a bit of wasabi between fish and rice, it made eating in the style I wanted difficult. The fish was fresh and good, but the prep was sloppy. I did order the other 3 nigiri and again: fish fresh, prep sloppy.    My friend had the rolls which were 6 or 8 cut but she left 4 pieces of each. I tried one piece and the thing was so sweet I couldn't taste any of the other ingredients.  She didn't want to order any more, and that kind of killed my experience so I couldn't eat any more whilst she just sat there.    Another couple came in and was seated at our former table and they were complaining that the prices had increased and I believe they ended up ordering a la carte, but were complaining to each other about the amount of dressing on their rolls and that the quality had gone down.    When our server came to see if we wanted anything else, we declined and I asked for a box for her unwanted rolls. I was advised that wasn't possible unless I wanted to pay full price for them.  They were inedible and I have a local homeless person I was going to drop them with as I wouldn't eat them. I understand the policy is to prevent piggy people who order 500 things and want to take most home to eat for the week but this was unwarranted because the quality was bad so the result was - the restaurant would rather throw it out, than allow the unsatisfied patron a compromise.   My dining partner asked if she could just pay for the price of the two rolls that were to be thrown away as it was less expensive than the all you can eat price, and she certainly didn't get her money's worth. She was told no. Then we received our bill with an automatically added 20% gratuity on the whole bill. For a two top. On a Saturday afternoon. In an empty restaurant.  I understand it for larger parties, especially with the all you can eat when the service warrants it. I had one beer, she had one Coke product, and I got a water side, no refills.  Very little attention was required, and most of the staff was stading behind the bar in service just chatting....the sushi chef was active, serving the few patrons at the bar...maybe 5? The restaurant never got full, during our time there, only one table of two moms with babies and another table of two men were there.    I came away unhappy with your business practice. I understand where it may be hard to enforce discretion with the auto 20% (which is what I tip on basic service, my friend says she tips 15% for decent/good service at lunch).  But we required very little attention, she certainly didn't get her money's worth and that killed my ability to enjoy the good fish at least.  Not being able to even give away the rest of the rolls really got up my nose knowing the food would be wasted and we certainly weren't taking advantage. The server was new, but pleasant and a decent worker. The food prep sloppy and it was very unsatisfying.    I want to give MOTO management the opportunity to respond.  People wanted me to put a review on Yelp but I believe people in food service genuinel want to provide a good experience where the customer comes away happy.  I post positive reviews on other sites - a reward for good work, so I am taking the time to contact you directly as I was sorely disappointed.    Thank you for your consideration, and a reply would be appreciated.   +++ They never answered me. Don't waste your money on a subpar restaurant. I would have happily spent  the 30+ dollars for my meal on a quality lunch at Hana or Sushi Ko, with excellent service and management that seems to care a little bit.  I give one star because the fish was fresh and our server was good, she just doesn't stand a chance to be rewarded at this place. Sad.

I went here for lunch on Saturday for the All-you can eat sushi.  It wasn't very crowed which is to say they had available seats at the bar and tables empty.  I sat at the sushi bar and waited 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged me.  The sushi chef asked if I had been helped.  I said no.  He said someone will be right with me.  5 min later I finally get a drink.  I stopped the guy and told him to just take my order and that I wanted the all you can eat special.  The chef was busy the whole time making orders so this isn't his fault but I got my food about 15 min after ordering.  My second order took almost 20 min.   Its hard to justify an all you can eat deal when it takes so long to get food.  They really need a second chef to help with the sushi.  They weren't attentive and it was really a sub par experience at best.

The food here was good.  I got the Vegas roll, which was delicious except the pieces were HUGE.  I had to eat each piece in two bites, with my hands, so I wasn't too happy about that. I prefer to eat sushi with chopsticks to avoid the mess.  At first I attempted to order the sushi combo.  I wanted to substitute the spicy tuna roll for something else (even another 1/2 Kalifornia roll that already comes with it), but they wouldn't let me.  That was a big let down.  Other than that, my fiance ordered the pad thai, which he liked, but it wasn't the best ever.  The best thing about Moto was the sushi ice cream, called mojos.  They are delicious!  A small order came with 6 pieces, I think, and that was too much for us.  It was a good deal for the money. I would highly suggest ordering it if you have room in your tummy (which is why I only ordered the Vegas roll).  The patrons seemed to be mostly in their 20s and 30s.  I think that's a good sign.  I'm giving Moto three stars because of their lack of substitution options and their high prices for sushi.  Their rice bowls seem like a good deal, though.

While in Phoenix for Easter weekend, the boyfriend and I decided to venture out and try some sushi.  I checked out yelp for suggestions, and after looking over Moto's website and snarky menu, we jumped in the car and drove over.   We were seated right away, and both decided to try the all you can eat.  I did the regular all you can eat deal, and Travis did the one w/ the Sapporo and sake.  I felt that for the price, it was a great deal. Especially coming from LA sushi prices which can be outrageous.   Travis did not read the rules and had to pay 50 cents for each piece he did not eat, which was a bummer, but I feel, it was put in the rules of the All You Can Eat deal so what are you gonna do?   The service was a bit slow, but it was clean, and the waitstaff was friendly.  I would probably go back if I wanted sushi again in Phoenix.   Their non-sushi menu looked tasty as well, so maybe next time ;)

I have now had the opportunity to visit Moto 5 times, and have never been disappointed. From their traditional renditions of sushi and sashimi, to their masterful unique creations, you will find a favorite, but will love exploring everything on the menu. Be sure to save some room for their Ice Cream sushi rolls (Mojo's), its like heaven in a roll. Great atmosphere, excellent customer service and just an all around perfect place to go when the mood for Sushi hits you! Enjoy

While I'm against any kind of all you can eat type places I have been to Moto a couple of times with my cousin who lived near by.  For around 22 bucks you get a sake bomb and all you can eat rolls and nigiri of a preselected group.  You can chose from around 9 or so basic rolls and half a dozen choices of nigiri.  It really was half decent.  The staff was a bit rude but the rolls were good enough to have a few.  If you are looking for knock out sushi and the whole authentic Japanese experience I would not recommend coming here.  But if you are looking for a decent deal and to have a drink and good enough sushi this is the place.

Came here for a girls night. It was my second time having Sushi in AZ since I moved from NY. I was scared that I wouldn't like sushi in AZ but I thoroughly enjoyed my food here. I had a combo that included yellow tail, salmon sashimi, and spicy tuna.  I had a Kirin beer.  The food,  service and atmosphere were all great. I came here a second time for Sunday brunch and tried their fried chicken and vegetable fried rice- both very, very good.    My only complaint would be the smart ass blurbs on the menu- they are quite condescending.  I feel like somebody in this place thinks they are cooler than everyone else which would be fine if they also showed appreciation for faithful patronage on their "witty" menu.

I love MOTO. I Crave their Curry Soup. It is amazing. And their Moto Chicken Salad has been a favorite of mine since back in their Shogun Express days. I am so glad I found it again. I've taken out the large and it fed my daughter and I for 2 days. I try to hit MOTO whenever I am even close to that part of town!!!
Great restaurant, love it! Happy hour is the bomb! Definitely recommend the Asian nachos and the sweet potato fries.

Stopped by for a quick lunch today... it has been a couple of years since my last visit, but everything seemed pretty much the same.  We had the fish tacos (panko-breaded salmon) and a shrimp tempura roll.  The tacos were pretty yummy, although I thought the "guac" was rather interesting - they must use green peas to make the (expensive) avocado go further.  It wasn't bad... just different.  We added the sweet potato fries for just an extra buck... good call! They were deliciously crispy, sweet, and salty. Mmm.  The tempura roll was a little underwhelming.  First off, it was approximately 2 inches in diameter.  Now, I'm not exactly a sushi connoisseur, but I couldn't fit an entire piece in my mouth... and it is WAY to hard to eat half a piece, you know?  They used carrot in the roll... which wouldn't have been a problem, except for it was large chunks of carrot (the size of half a baby carrot).  It was really distracting from the texture I expect in a tempura roll... they should just call it a Carrot Roll, since that is all you notice with that big ol' crunch!   All-in-all, it was a pleasant lunch with pleasant service.  A few tweaks to the food would help bump it up in my book.
Awesome happy hour, friendly staff, the food was pretty great. the owner was taking the time to make sure everything was good, his name was Vince awesome place will go again soon

Moto is so good! I feel fortunate to live so close to a place this good.   All the sushi is great - the best I've had in Phx other than RA.  There's also a huge selection of beers and a big menu aside from sushi for non raw fish eaters (there's always one).

Delicious! This is my FAVORITE spot in the valley... Not really a sushi eater, but their Las Vegas Roll is off the charts! Some other favorites include the Moto Chicken Salad, the Asian Nachos, the Yakisoba and the Quesadilla! Would eat here everyday if I could!  PS - Try their iced green tea! So good!
This place rocks.... Love going here and the owner is fantastic.  The staff is always friendly and remembers who we are.  Their Moto Chicken Salad is awesome and so are the rice bowls.

I hate to be an asshole, but I hated this place.   I came here yesterday with a group of friends for lunch. Our 15 minute wait turned into what felt like an hour, when impatient me finally went in to see what the deal was... To my surprise, there was an empty table for a party of 7 that was just sitting there. Are you kidding me? So I ask one of the servers if its cool that we snag it, to which he said Yes. Just cram in tight. NO big deal. So I go and grab my friends to alert them that the table was ready, and when I walk back in, some stupid little bitchy server is standing there glaring at me telling me she "needs a minute to move the table" while huffing and puffing and sighing and just generally being a little queen about having to move a freakin table. I'm sorry, isn't it your JOB to accommodate patrons? I thanked her as she stormed off, and say something shitty to her about being such an inconvenience. I never saw her again throughout the duration of my visit.   Star removal #1.  We all sit down, and continue waiting for our drink order to be placed. Finally, after about 10 minutes, this happens, but were without menus, so no one *really* knows what they want, Waitress huffs, rolls her eyes, and goes to grab menus. We look, she takes our order, but only for about 6 of the 8 people at the table. She somehow forgot about the tallest man at the table and the girl sitting across from him. Once she comes back, after 3 attempts, she gets the order wrong, serves me my sake without a cup or a glass for my beer. Seriously?  Star removal #2.  We finally order. Mind you, this was the longest lunch in the universe, because at this point we had already been there for an hour. Luckily our waitress got the order correct, except a few of us ended up waiting at least 45 minutes for our rolls to come out.. specifically the Avocado rolls.. did you run to California to grow and pick them yourself because.. wow.   Star removal #3.  They managed to Eff up the most important part, which was the SUSHI. My unagi was not fresh, the spicy tuna tasted like plastic, they only had smoked salmon, no raw. They waitress *highly* recommended the dessert roll, which was ice cream rolled in rice krispys.. I know that sounds awesome and all, but im here for sushi, not ice cream. Also, on the menus, it says they have the choice to put a grat on ANY size party.. this to me is absolutely absurd.  Star Removal #4  I'm sorry, but when you see a PARTY OF EIGHT slide in, you do everything in your power to make these people happy, because if you don't, you can expect that "We can grat anyone we want" to be the only grat you get. Nothing additonal.  Get your shit together Moto, and maybe remind your waitstaff that their JOB is to make sure your patrons enjoy themselves, not make us feel like a burden. If it weren't for them, this review wouldn't have been so shitty.  P.S. Start to finish, lunch took 2.5 hours.   FAIL.

Worst customer service I've ever experienced. Food is actually decent but their lack or care and absolute disregard for the customer is unacceptable. If you wait too long for your food or to be seated they do not care nor do they apologize. If you request a substitution due to allergies etc they refuse to accommodate any requests. Even if you are willing to pay an upcharge. Additionally, their overall attitude both in person and on their website and on their menu blurbs is so sarcastic and nasty that it is blatantly rude. I cannot in good faith ever recommend this restaurant knowing how little they care about their customers and their dining experience.
Good sushi. I have food allergies and the waitress helped me select all sorts of dishes.   The place is small but cute and clean. I'd go back since its right near my office.

Place was nice and clean  . Server was prompt . We tried the tuna roll and California  roll the rice was cold and dry . We also ordered  orange chicken  and teriyaki   beef. Both were very sweet.maybe a little  over cooked.

I got the exit wound. Bowl was ok. Ok as in edible. The chicken was really dry but the sauce was tasty. The peppers were way overcooked and mushy. This place just likes to overcook everything... But that's not why this place sucks. The service i got here was just terrible. Nobody greeted me even tho three workers were clearly present behind the bar. I ordered to go and they made me wait five mins before even acknowledging me. I was actually having to debate waving them down! Eventually the girl came to greet me at the register. She was unable to do two things at once and gave an ice tea cup priority over me after making we wait for her attention. She counted my change wrong and I had to ask for the extra dollar she forgot about. At least she didn't question her mistake. This place seems like it has potential in the food and I would come back if they would stop over cooking everything. But the service is unacceptable and needs work. For this reason, if I ever came back here I would give extra time for my order and come in expecting to count my change and be forced to wait for a to go order that was already sitting at the counter ready to go.

Moto is an all time favorite and will drive out of my way just to pop in. Have brought several friends here including my wife and they keep coming back not only because of the food and epic beer list but the service is great, ask for Charity, and staff attentive. Best Vietnamese pork ever.
I just had the best brussels sprouts in the city seriously everyone should  be coming here and try them.

Third time there was not a charm. Sushi rolls were dry and I was starving.  We got the beef bowl and the meet was salty and dry. Service  was also slow. I should  have ordered  the  crispy chicken . Place was busy but the food was unacceptable.  I will  skip going there

We usually go here for their Sunday happy hour. The sushi is good and I've had their bbq pork noodles which have a lot of flavor, but for the most part it's not very authentic. Something different was their sushi ice cream, that was pretty awesome, you cant really go wrong with rice crispy treats and ice cream! The service has been very hit or miss.
Sushi was average & choices extremely limited. Drinks watered down. Atmosphere and decor are tops

Ok, I'm updating my review. I come here far too often not to bump it up another notch. Plus, now I don't have to worry about someone calling me out when I stop by for my favorite chicken salad. Honestly, this is probably the best bang for your buck HH around. Who doesn't appreciate cheap and delicious food? Obviously, past Morgan didn't.

It was mediocre at best and I'm one that can find enjoyment in a lot of things in life. The service was good, our waitress was attentive. I would give you her name but unfortunately she didn't give it to us and I'm one of those people who always remember our servers names. She is a part of the reason why this even got another star. I saw another server completely ignore her table and they got upset so I guess it depends on who you get here.  I feel like this is a hipster joint. The food wasn't that flavorful. It wasn't horrible. I would take a small hole in the wall sushi place with good sushi and better atmosphere.  My OCD part of the review: The decor was almost there besides the hideous zebra vase. I know that this part of the review is obsessive but look at the picture! Haha I couldn't stop looking at it during dinner.
Wouldn't seat me at a table because I was by myself... waited 5 minutes without having my drink order taken at the bar... left...

I've been here several times and while the food is merely decent, the happy hour is good. However, I ate here yesterday and experienced the worst customer service. When it came time to pay my bill the waitress told me their system was down and they couldn't take my card. Half and hour later nothing had changed. I was forced to walk to an ATM and  take cash out. When I returned I figured I'd receive a discount after waiting for so long, but that was not the case. Not only did they not want to give me any discount, but when the manager came over I was told $3 was all she could do. I don't understand why she thought that was okay for a $40 bill.   I will never return and I will never recommend. By far the worst customer service I've received.

Don't order sushi here. It's expensive and taste like holes. The wonton nacho is good but eat it fast because it gets soggy very fast, like too fast. I like the wings but too little for what they charge. Don't order pho either unless you never had Vietnamese noodles before then it probably tastes ok. But to everyone else that has, don't do it. If you've read that the sushi is good by others, they are probably friends of the owner or something because, really? 5 stars for this sushi is crazy talk. Service is good and some of the other apps are good. Katsu chicken is good I order it with slaw and brown rice.

This is a local hotspot.  I've been going here for years and the employees say hello to you when you walk in.  Happy hour sushi M-F 3-6:15, all you can eat sushi on Saturday from 11-2:30, happy again on Sundays until 6pm I believe.  Different micro brews all of the time-always fun to taste :)  Check it out for yourself!
Love Moto's salads, and their sushi is good as well.  Also can't count the number of time I have called in for a chicken teriyaki to go, and had a great on the go dinner.

If  you're looking for a casual, unpretentious sushi bar then go to Moto Sushi. The ambiance is like Starbucks (mood lighting) but with sushi. Vince is the Owner and has a great knack of remembering your name, which gives it a 'mom and pop' feel. I love the marketing of this place from the menus to the picture on the wall (hot asian model named Jayd Lovely by the hostess stand-shamless plug, don't hate). The food portions are perfect and this is truly important to me because I've yet to meet anyone who can out-eat me. I love their custom chicken/rice bowls, sushi is always fresh, and the moto chicken wings are spicy and moist. End your meal with an order of mojos or two (I don't like to typically share my dessert unless I'm in love with you) which is dee-licious!  Oh! And ask for their underground sushi menu to spice things up a bit.
Vince the owner is fantastic and always here to ensure great service. (As is his fiancé Janet) great people. Support local business!

Ordered two basic and simple rolls and received sushi that looked rolled by a child.  Sloppy presentation and rice was super tacky to the point of staleness.  Decided not to buy any more rolls since they failed the first two tester rolls.  If you cannot make a spicy tuna roll you have no business calling yourself a sushi place.  Pad Thai sounded yummy and ordered chicken added to the dish.  We were going to forgive the rolls since we can be a little snooty about sushi, but shouldn't you be?  Its not like you ordered anything cheap.  After two bites into the Pad Thai I bit into a bone! Mmm...wasnt expecting that!  I spit out the bone and looked through the Pad Thai to find three bone shards in the noodles.  Wanting to bring it to the attention of the management, cause I would want to know if it were my place if bone fragements were being served by accident to my patrons, we waited 15 mins to be told that they would make us another dish.  Aftering waiting for so long, the appetite for this place was gone and we asked if they could just remove the item from the bill.  The manager said,"Of course, sorry."  No big deal until we got the bill and only the additional charge for chicken was removed from the bill.  Asking to speak to the manager again since we were told the entree was going to be removed we were told, "I took the chicken off since that is what you had a problem with and everyone know that is the risk you take when eating chicken, cuz chicken's have bones." WHAT?! I was dumbfounded, not only bad food, bad service from management (server was great!) but we were actually insulted!  Wow, interesting business ethics.  No mo Moto fo sho!

The service is always great.  Everyone is friendly.  The food is amazing.  I love the spicy tuna roll and california roll.  My husband had the chow mein with beef, which I tasted and I started eating that too.  I couldn't get enough of any of it.  They have indoor and outdoor seating and they offer take-out.  I know a lot of people speak highly of the sushi restaurants in Old Town, but if you just don't want to go all that way, definitely go to Moto.  You'll love it.  And for those Spicy food lovers, Moto offers all levels of spice.  Just be careful what you ask for.  If you know what I mean.  The name of the menu item will say it all.

I woke up wanting both Mexican and sushi, so what's a girl to do but go to Moto! I remembered their Asian nachos and before stepping foot out of bed visions of them were dancing in my head! I was kind of worried bc I know saturdays they have the all u can eat sushi thing and I've heard it gets packed and service is slow, but the nachos on my brain were too hard to ignore so we pressed on!  It was near-full, but we were seated and had a small chicken nachos in no time! So flippin good I can't even tell you! The sauce is like half BBQ half hot sauce, and it's fantastic! We got an extra side of that and of sriracha (bc sauce, to me, is a must-have).  We decided to go with the a.y.c.e. deal, and I ordered 4 rolls and 2 kinds of nigiri. Our server then turned to my companion and asked what he would like?!?!?!? Huh? I'm not a competitive eater! I had ordered for both of us. She got all bristly, and I told her we knew that each person pays 18.95 for ayce, and we were cool with that, but just ordering together. It was a big deal that needn't be, but whatev's.   I'm not a fan of smoked salmon, but the Vegas roll was still good. Fry anything and it works. The tootsie was our favorite and the spicy yellowtail our least. We couldn't finish our order and didn't order anything else. Our server said she felt bad for charging us both the ayce price when we only ordered one plate, but she had no problem doing it. They must have a lot of losers coming in trying to feed the whole fam at one price I guess. Not so cool for us normal people. I will be back for those damn nachos, but probably won't ever do the ayce again. If you can pack it away-go for it, if not-just stick with what you like and avoid the drama.

An absolute travesty if you're here for sushi. An AYCE sushi menu limited to Krab (yes with a K ), smoked salmon, tuna, unagi, yellowtail, and rolls that look like they're made by Sushi-bot 5000 that shoots Krab as excrement. The fish themselves are atrocious and taste like they've had better days. The Krab seems to be some kind of binding agent they try to hide in every space imaginable just to fill you up. The sushi rice is the only thing that was prepared correctly and it was a blessing in disguise for it to be served by bushels in each bite. The service is borderline senile and their "AYCE rules" are written very condescendingly. As we were near finished, a friend had asked if I got my moneys worth. My response...  "yes, by not ordering anymore."

Stopped in here for lunch one day and wasn't pleased with the experience. The rolls were warm and fell apart. The service was fair at best and the place wasn't even very busy. Not that Phoenix is known for it's Sushi, but you'd expect better from a place like this. All that said, the menu is a hoot and worth a read, just don't order anything from it.
one of my go-to spots when I go to town. pretty much everything is very good. Yaki soba tasty but dry.

The sushi is good here, but my favorite dish is the spicy shrimp and chicken bowl (with noodles).  I've been here over and over for this dish.  The hottest sauce you can get with it is the real deal!  It's so hot it will make your mouth numb.  The owner is always around to make sure the place is running smoothly.  The bartenders are friendly and helpful.  I've never seen anyone unhappy with a meal here so give it a try!

This is my second time here and I like it. The service was quick, delightful and considerate. They were busy for lunch and it took a while to get our rolls. The food was tasty and just enough to fill our tummies.
We got take out from here during a spring break trip. Noodles, sushi, edamame, popcorn shrimp. All delicious. I ate the leftover noodles, cold, for breakfast, the next morning.

In town for a week for work and had heard good things about this place so decided to go for dinner with my coworkers. Below is a review off the dishes we had  Pad Thai- the portions were huge. The spirit peanut was amazing and overall it met the expectation for decent pad Thai  Spring Rolls- these were very small compared to traditional spring rolls. They didn't seem to be fresh, the rice paper was a bit tough.   - classified bowl- this bowl is no joke! If out like spicy this is defiantly for you! You will sweat and cry but over all the dish is really good.   The portions on the main dishes are pretty big. It was average joint. Nothing to get super excited about but it won't disappoint.

I have had better experiences in the past, but yesterday just wasn't good. They weren't busy- but the food (even appetizers ) took a long time to come out. And it was cold. The food was not tasty at all.. half cold, over-seasoned, and just a weird mash up of flavors. The waitress barely heckled on us the whole time we were there...  not sure if will come back

My husband and I stopped in here the other night after a birthday party. We ordered the coconut curry soup, sashimi, and each had a dinner.  The food was tasty and filling. We haven't had that much food for that low of a price in a long time. I don't think anywhere else serves such generous portions of sashimi, and definitely not at that price.  We will definitely make this a regular place to visit.

strictly going for the sushi is a no-no, however they have much more to offer.  they have about the best happy hour you can can find in town, cheap rolls, aps and beers.  i also am a fan of the dumplings and seaweed soup.  None of that holds a saki bomb to the dessert.  Now don't get me wrong i don't really like desert often, but when someone comes up with an idea of a "sushi roll" dessert that contains, nuget, ice cream, rice crispy treats, chocolate sauce i am interested.  when they serve it in a bowl cut like sushi and looking like sushi i am SOLD!  do yourself a favor go to happy hour and get the dessert role.

If you're looking for original, authentic, and fresh food -- this isn't the place. The concept is fun and whimsical like a Japanese girl taking pictures and making a peace sign, but it's all make-up no substance. The rolls are weak and I would not recommend the yakisoba.   If you're a typical Phoenician, this is a great starter place for the non-adventurous types that fein at being adventurous. There is nothing weird on the menu and almost all of it tastes like chicken!
I've never had anything I didn't love at Moto! Sushi, bowls, burger, calamari - all yummy! One of my favorites in Phoenix for sure.

Arggggh! This place had so much potential: great beer list, solid design and decor, and not too far from our house.  Unfortunately, they don't have great sushi. They don't even have good enough sushi to bring me back despite the beer list. The search for decent, reasonably priced sushi continues...

I had some pretty good sushi at this place last week.  I didnt even know it was there!  The inside and atmosphere is pretty laid back and chill.  The sushi is good, we had 4 rolls and they were all good size and all tasted great!  Our waitress was very friendly and made sure we were always hydrated!  I am for sure gonna come back here!

We stopped in here previously to meet some friends who were dying for the burger they used to have on the menu. Once we realize you don't have the burger anymore, the gin told us to go elsewhere. But, I have been DYING to have the Chicken Wonton Soup ever since.   So my bf and I came in for dinner last night. We started off with the crispy spring rolls which were awesome, my only complaint was having to share them. I don't like sharing.   I obviously ordered the wonton soup and he ordered some noodle dish. Since my soup came out 5 minutes before his meal, I was finished and staring at him eat, which I'm sure was quite annoying. Oh well, it caused him to offer to share his dinner with me and it was yummy!!  We took a vote after we left and decided to add this place into our rotation.

I dislike writing negative reviews but I have tried this place a dozen times over the past 3 years and before the food was okay, decent atmosphere, and the service was very poor.  Now the service was great! But the food did disappoint.  I ordered the surfer roll... It may have been the worst thing I have ever ordered.. I hope they read this review and change it but I won't be returning for at least 6 months to a year..

Happy hour is designed to make one happy. The fact they had one sat evening with things I like on it made me happy for a new hours.  There are a few 1/2 priced sushi rolls like a Spicy tuna and Phily roll. 1/2 some apps and beer $3 specials.   The rolls are regularly 7.50 ish so 3.50 on happy hour, as for quality it was decent however with a spicy tuna or Phily roll it is hard to really mess them up. The added avacado to them was nice.  We also had a veggie spring roll $3.50 Then 1/2 off for happy hour.  A soft rice noodle skin around fresh veggies sushi rice and peanut sauce. It was great like Vietnam meets Thailand.  They were nice enough to turn down the loud music for us make it a pleasant place to be, the curtains are cool and the beer selection included some micro brews. Not bad at all.
Had very low expectations given some of the reviews read but despite busy lunch crowd, service was good and food solid.  Easy in/out for business discussion with client.

Moto is yummy! I don't eat sea food so the only Sushi I eat is Cucumber Rolls or Vegetarian Rolls. There are plenty of variety of dishes to choose from that include build your own to include Sea Food, Chicken, Beef, and Vegetarian. You can also choose your temapture. The side dishes which some are included in the Happy Hour are very tasty.  I have been eating there of and on since the resturant moved in the neighboorhood. I can't say they always have the best customer service however recently I sat at the bar and the bartendar was the best. She really impressed me.   I don't drink but they have a large varitey of beers and wines. Many I have never seen or heard of to choose from. The bartendar told me the owner loves to switch the beer regulary to give different options.   If you are looking for a trendy place with a great variety of food this is the place to eat.  There is a full service bar with a creative Sushi Chef to watch. It is a small resturant with a big menu.

BEST SUSHI/ASIAN DINING & CRAFT BEER COMBO you will find in the state of Arizona. The craft beer selection alone is the best in a 5 mile radius, and they have high quality sushi and Asian food on top of that. Neighborhood place, friendly vibe, outstanding service. Definitely worth checking out...

Very tasty food. Everyone dining with us absolutely loved it. Good level of spicyness, and good system to tell how spicy things are. Good service as well, and willing and able to change orders. Will be coming back here.

My oldest daughter and I are trying a different sushi place every month Moto at 16th and Bethany was our first.  It's a pretty busy corner with the sprouts and Mcdonalds but parking wasn't an issue.  We were seated pretty quickly as there was no waiting for a patio seat.  Everyplace we go we will order the California roll and tootsie roll.  The California roll tasted so fresh I was actually surprised. It was very tasty and we both loved it.  The tootsie roll was also very good. The eel aside was very sweet and tasty. I had a hard time tasting the fish in the tootsie roll but I enjoyed it nonetheless. We used the low sodium soy sauce and that was rather salty the wasabi was fresh as was the ginger.  We give it 4 fish heads out of 5

I had a great meal tonight. When I went to In-N-Out burger after wasting my time in the WORST STEAMING PILE OF CRAP RESTAURANT IN PHOENIX!  Even the water was terrible!  Half of the food was cold when it was served 15 minutes after the first dishes hit the table.   DO NOT WASTE TOUR TIME AND THINK THAT YOU WILL HAVE GOOD FOOD OR SERVICE HERE.   Get a frozen lean cuisine rice bowl, open it and put it under your fridge and let the mice relieve themselves in it for a few days ... you'll be much better off

Best. Wonton. Soup. Ever!!!!! I'm Asian and I have had A LOT of wonton soup in my life. Why is it so good? It's the broth. It tastes like the product of hard work and a lot of time, like maybe one of those recipes that's a 26-step process with hours to rise/chill/whatever in between. It's not too salty, and has the perfect blend of spices. If this soup were a person, it would be the guy who hardly speaks, but when he does the few words he says make a lasting impact.   The wontons themselves are average, they could stand to be a little bigger. But they are supported by the magical broth. I am noting that the next time I catch a cold, I'm ordering a big bowl of Moto's wonton soup for pickup!

Another new place discovered through my Sushi group.  As has been common, large groups with seperate checks tend to challenge them, but the food was propery delivered and very delious.  I enjoyed my standard Philly Roll as well as a Mark Roll and Mayflower Roll, all of which was very good.  I look forward to another opportunity to return and try other rolls on the menu.  Oh and you definetly have to try the MOJOS, very tastey desert.
Its our second time here and they messed up our order both times and the service is horrible.
I never eat sushi here but i LOVE their spicy teriyaki chicken bowl  Love it!

One of my favorite places. Aside from the witty menu, the food is top notch! I usually get a bowl and my husband usually gets the riblets. I also almost always start with the caterpillar roll, it is super cute and always cures my craving. I recently ordered the grilled shrimp tacos, they were impressive. I will be ordering those again! I may have a new favorite! Fantastic atmosphere and always spectacular service. It's probably one of the best places to meet for lunch or have a nice dinner. I never feel over or under dressed whether I'm going casual or dressed up for a date with the hubby. It's a comfortable, moderately priced, great place to grab a bite.

I gave Moto a few tries because it was the closest sushi place to where I was living (would get it for take out).  Each time I was mildly disappointed....sushi is medicore, nothing really stood out to me.  Their salmon sashimi is smoked, wierd in my opinion being a sashimi lover.  Wish I could them better, but not impressed.

Started coming here about a year ago for the saturday all you can eat days. For the price it can't be beat. I have been here at least 15 times now and the fish is almost always fresh and good, a few times i have had a bad piece but even the best places I have been get a bad one once in awhile. The selection isn't the largest on the all you can eat but the basics are all covered with tuna, yellowtail, unagi, las vegas rolls, spicy tuna, philly, boston, alaska and spicy yellowtail all being on the list. The dessert they have the mojos are of a kind and different all the tie but never a disappointment if you have room after all the sushi.  They also have a full bar and often feature different specialty brews here as well. You can also add a sake bomber to your all you can eat for i think $4 so not a bad deal.  The gripes here is that the service is not the best as the waitresses know that they add 20% tip to all of the all you can eat bills s they don't seem to try to hard. it can take awhile to get a drink refilled (unless its alcohol and an extra charge). The other thing is that it can take awhile for the sushi to get done. I have no problem with this most days as for the amount of food I and my friends orders it takes awhile to make but on occasion it can be excessive.  Despite the fact that there are other all you can eats closer to me I willingly drive the 20-30min to come here on Saturdays. For $17 this is a great deal and a good place to eat.  P.S. if you ride a motorcycle they have helmet/jacket hooks inside and allow parking on the side walk as the owner is a rider.

This was one of my favorite Sushi places to date.  You have to be "in the know" & ask for the "underground sushi menu", the one that doesn't exist!  The service can be a bit slow, the but the staff is friendly.

C'mon, Moto. Get your act together. I've been eating here for years and have experienced how both the service and food quality has gotten poorer and poorer. Service, while polite, is always extremely slow no matter whether it's busy or not. I've put up with that because I love the B Noodles so much, but the last half dozen or so times I've ordered it, it tastes like a completely different dish. Awful consistency. Not worth the gamble anymore, time for me to find a new noodle dish elsewhere.

I always look for a good sushi place during my travels. I found one here in Phoenix at Moto sushi. They have style with a unique flair, classy yet casual, and tasty sushi. I've always received friendly service on my visits and they keep my glass full; these are a must to satisfy me. They have outdoor seating and the patio is dog friendly.  The sushi is good and they have many interesting combinations. Best of all they have spicy sushi rolls. I love the April roll and the Volcano roll.  The decor is modern. They have bar seating where you can watch the rolls made. The music is eclectic and at just the right noise level to clearly hear it, yet not have to scream to talk to the people at the other side of the table.  I've visited Moto on several occasions and will be here several more before I leave.

I work very close to Moto and take advantage of this place as much as possible.  The food is great, well priced and the beer selection is perfect.  I generally get one of their bowls, a sushi spread or the always awesome Moto Chicken Salad.  The atmosphere is great at the bar with friendly staff, multiple TV's to give you something to watch during lunch, and a well done happy hour menu.  If you want to sit down they offer tables for all size parties and booths to sink into.    What I like about Moto is that is a stand alone restaurant with a great menu, great staff, well thought out bar, simple yet keen beer selection in a friendly casual dining environment.  I never feel over or under dressed and I don't feel like they are tying too hard to stand out.  They let their menu, staff and great environment do that for them and it makes a great atmosphere.  I have never left Moto feeling let down or charged too much.  Everything is well balanced and I really appreciate that.  I definitely recommend Moto for anyone looking for a great casual sushi place that offers really great sushi, drinks and other menu items at a reasonable price.  A++

This place is more of a bar than a sushi restaurant. This sushi is pretty average. The quality and freshness just isn't quite there. I've been to many sushi joints in my time, and can tell you that Moto sushi is a decent place for your average sushi consumer, but won't impress most others. Rolls are pretty generic, and sloppily made. Service was good, which is why it gets 2 stars. Prices are up there among better restaurants, so I suggest you look elsewhere cuz it ain't cheap. They have a happy hour menu, and also an all-you-can eat menu...if that interests you. They are the only sushi joint within a few miles, otherwise the competition would eat them up in no time. You can try it for yourself, but I'm just trying to save you a few bucks here...

The food & beverages at Moto are awesome.  The service needs a little help, as they don't always check on you to see if you need another beer or a water refill. They might just need more staff.  I award 4 stars because I know I will be back for the beer and food. Awesome selection of craft brews on tap, only $3/glass during happy hour (3pm - 6:15pm). Cheap appetizers during happy hour too. Win!  Numerous veggie choices (that are actually GOOD).   The wonton nachos minus meat were awesome.  The tofu yakisoba was awesome.  The veggie rolls were awesome.  I wish this place was closer to my house.

Recently went back here for a special beer tasting and would have to say everything was a step up from the first time I was there except for the fact that it still smelled by fish.  don't know what they need to do to get rid of that smell but it would be a bit more pleasant if they did...might even get 5 stars!

You might want to reconsider ordering the PHO.  Completely flavorless.  My guess would be the broth is made from a powered mix.  Add the fact that they charge $10 makes it even worse.  Meatballs were rubbery, sliced beef dry and chewy.   Owners need to consider taking this off the menu.  Would have sent it back but a co-worker went on a lunch run and picked this up for me to go.  Gross, Gross Gross....

Service was good - I was disappointed by a lukewarm miso soup and almost cold brown rice.  We ordered the sushi/sashimi platter to share, and it tasted fine with an okay presentation. The green tea is unique and refreshing. We ordered the small Moto for dessert - and that was delicious and a small was plenty for two people.  Overall, if I was really craving sushi and I was near 16th Street and Glendale, I'd go again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for Moto.

OUR EXPERIENCE WAS OFFENSIVE. Worst sushi in town. Way overpriced. Bad service. Sushi was rubbery, so we ordered sweet potato fries, wontons, soup Etc and it was all disappointing. What a waste of a date night!

I've been here a few times and stopped in recently for lunch. I had the pad thai this time which was good but felt it was missing something. Not quite sure. I really wish they had lunch specials there as I think I might go there a bit more during the work week. I will go back but it's not at the top of my list.  I sat at the bar and the service was great (always has been good the two times I've been to Moto).

Have been here a couple times now and cannot stop raving about it!! I was lucky enough to have had a girlfriend that worked there a while back tell me about the "hidden menu" that no one really knows about. I ordered the "Senorita" off that menu and have been going back for it ever since. Of course their happy hour is RIDICULOUS, so cheap and really good!! I feel sorry for the waitresses because of all the horrible customers they must get that don't know how to tip at happy hour (in case you don't know its always tip what the meal would have been before the discount). But if they have bad customers I wouldn't know, I always get the best service!!  Awesome, yummy, and healthy! Now go have some Sushi;)

Ok. Appetizer calamari came out room temperature, told server,  new calamari came hot. Fine fixed. Kids orange chicken  comes out first, good recovery. But, our food....hmmmm, kid finished bowl before we got ours, not terrible, but odd. Exit Wound bowl, delicious and a lot of food. Starts out not spicy but then grows on you, by last bite my mouth is comfortably warm it was good. Now more bad, wife's Pho comes out considerably later than my food, beef in pho is a little off, maybe D grade beef? But the bowl is huge. BUT 4 pieces of beef a little bigger than an oreo cookie. Asked the server if this was the norm and she said yes in a uninterested voice. 2 good dishes, bad delivery of entrées, not exciting pho and meh service. We'll stick sushi from Moto from here on

A M A Z I N G their roles are huge and great. I went with a friend who lives over that way. The owners were so nice and friendly. I cant believe I am just finding this place.   The underground menu is now public... I thought that was kind of cool tho, what I heard of it.   Only con, the waitress was a little slow, but she was nice and they were busy...so I will give her that :)

For the last time we decided to go back, little did we know we got the same waitress and she had more of an attitude this time. She was rude to my sister and that is the last straw with this place. When I worked in the food industry I was nice to even those who I thought didn't deserve my kindness, but it was MY JOB AND I DECIDED TO WORK THERE but I guess that is dead and gone. I'd rather go and pay more at a scottsdale restaurant then having to deal with a waitress who seems to always be in a crappy mood. Also, she ended up charging us wrong which came out to more, but why bother arguing with someone who is already sour.

I've been coming to Moto for 5+ years and have seen a lot of turn over. The last few years the management has shown A LOT of improvement! Charity is one of our FAVORITE bartenders in central phx. She's never suggested one thing we haven't liked. She shows a PERFECT example of leaving personal issues at the door, like any GREAT bartender should do. I have always had a great experience at Moto, the owner really knows how to run a successful business!

I have frequented this place over the last 2 years for lunch.  Hadn't been in for a while and stopped in to get a "to-go" order last evening to take home for dinner, BIG MISTAKE!!!  Ordered the chicken bowl (which I always get) with brown rice, teriyaki sauce (orange NOT spicy) with vegis.  Also ordered the crab puffs, hadn't had them here before and I was extra hungry!  The crab puffs were burnt on the edges, all of them!  Had to crack off all the burnt sides and was left with the soggy middle.  How to you burn the edges and undercook the middle?  The crab part was lack luster.  The aioli side sauce that is served with these, well lets say I had high expectations and the sauce fell waaaaay short of being at all tasty, bland...bland...bland...  On to the chicken bowl.  I was surprised to see that the chicken is now served in square chunks.  Wow, someone forgot to put ANY seasoning on the chicken, again bland!!!  They also put the spicy teriyaki sauce on my meal which I did not order so my main course of the meal was ruined!    So, $16.00 later, I had about 1/3 of the appetizer that could even be consumed and threw that out and my dinner, well, the 96% full container went in the trash.  I'm not even going to risk my money on gong back for lunch.  I was truly let down.  Lack of seasoning and lack of general cooking skills in preparation coupled with the wrong sauce on the order, too many other options (Pei Wei here I come)!

The lemon grass pork is 2 stars on a generous day. Disappointing, since they tout their Vietnamese selections as being specialties. The pork was tough and the noodles were more like lo mein than the vermicelli type rice noodles I was expecting. Portions are certainly generous enough... I like that you can make your own rice bowl. That's the direction I recommend if you come here.

Awesome place! I'm not a big sushi eater but they have a lot more than sushi, their fish tacos are some of the best in the valley and if you like hot foods they have a select choice of those too. Great atmosphere, televisions so you don't miss any games while having great food at the same time.

Poor service,offensive material on the menu. Not recommended if you ever order take out/ to go orders...your food would likely sitting on counter, lying, waiting, forgotten. take your business elsewhere.

I frequent this place, it is in the neighborhood and has great sushi rolls.  We went for happy hour and ordered 3 sushi rolls and 2 appetizers, which were all only $5 each.  We had the wings which were crispy and amazing, as well as the crispy gyoza served with cilantro and ponzu sauce.  My favorite roll was the Alaska roll which has smoked salmon on top with crab mix inside.  We sat at the bar and received excellent service.  They have a good selection of craft beers on tap and they will let you try samples to see which one you might prefer.  It has modern decor inside with original art on the wall, and a very pleasing atmosphere.

I really enjoy Moto's Happy Hour. What makes it great is you can get non-sushi items at Happy Hour in addition to sushi. This is a good compromise when you are going with someone who isn't wild about sushi. They do only offer 4 rolls during the Happy (Kalifornia, Tootsie, Philadelphia and Spicy Tuna) but all four are fresh and delicious. We also tried the asian nachos which we both thought were amazing! They are made with friend wontons some kind of spicy cheese, chicken and avocado. (I'm sure there was more on it but we ate it so fast there wasn't time for much research.)   You can't beat the Happy hour prices!  For 2 people we had a total of 3 beers, 3 orders of sushi and a small asian nacho and it came to $24. One big improvement over last time was the service was much faster. This place is good for dinner and the AYCE Sushi on Saturdays, but for a first timer I would really recommend the Happy Hour over anything else.

As I write this I am trying to contain my anger. Walked in at 6:15 was seated immediately. Great. Sat for 10 minutes before the HOSTESS came to us and offered us water. She brings us water and we play the waiting game. 6:40 we had to call the HOSTESS over to take our order and we're a little irritated. Still have not been seen by a single server. Now it's 7:10. Appetizer is not out and we see servers walking around and it took a while for one to notice us. She came over asked if we were doing okay. We told her honestly no. And she immediately took action and did what a good server would do. She showed concern and wanted to fix it. The only good customer service was shown by the hostess Kaylie and the server Charity. Charity managed to comp our meal. We really appreciate their work and honestly the rest of the staff needs to look to them as examples of good customer service. I will be possibly coming back but next time i guess we just have to accept the fact we'll be playing the waiting game. Still good food though. They got that going for them.

The owner here is a jackass. They recently put up a giant banner that says "we (heart) you long time", with the (heart) being a caricature of a geisha. It's super racist, as if they put up a banner that said "ching chong" on it. I told the owner in a very kind note - just letting him know, in case he wasn't already aware, that many people of Asian descent find that phrase and that image offensive, and he responded with a bunch of laughing emojis! If you go to their website, it says the owner is the "first anglo sushi chef in Arizona" - big whoop, but clearly race (particularly the white race) matters to this guy. So if you like your California roll served with a big white sheet, enjoy, but otherwise I would steer clear.

I have been to Moto a couple of times and the food is good.  However last week we had TERRIBLE service!  We arrived around 8:15 and the sign said they close "nine-ish".  I asked our server about a wine on the menu and she said it was new.  My friend asked if she could bring a taste, and her answer was "i don't think so.  It comes in a bottle".  We said - we only want a glass and she repeated the same thing. ( Is that as opposed to a box?)   I just ordered it anyway and low and behold it was not very good.   We then ordered our food.  My two friends ordered sushi.  They were just starting to eat when a server came by and asked for the soy sauce.  My friends asked if she was going to replace it, and she said no - she needed to clean it for the night.  She forced my friends to load up on the soy sauce so she could take it.  The rest of the night the staff proceeded to hound us and ask us if they could take our plates - even when we were still eating.  This was not much past 9.  I know we were running a bit late, but there were still other people in the restaurant.  And finally, we were sitting outside and one of the staff members came out and loudly cleared his sinuses and spit on ground near us.  It was just gross.  Food is good - not great.  Definitely not worth the terrible service.

All you can eat limited sushi on Saturday for around $20. Sold. I crashed Dottsy Z's  party with two other lovely ladies (Hi Amber and Debi) this past Saturday after literally stepping off of a plane and seeing her post that she was here. The funny thing was that I wasn't really hungry, until I saw all the yummy food in front of me. Eel rolls, Las Vegas rolls, Toosie Maki Rolls, Spicy Tuna Rolls, good lawd I was in heaven. I ate so much that I arrived looking "skinny" and I left looking as if I was expecting a baby sometime in the very near future lol. Sad case yes. Our waitress was extremely nice but a little overworked since it appeared as if she was working the entire restaurant solo. So if you are hankering for some sushi, go on a Saturday over to Moto Sushi. But be warned, you must eat everything that you order if you order off the all you can eat, or you will be charged 50 cents per piece that you leave on your plate. So don't overdo it. (We left nada! lol)

I'm new to Arizona, so I'm constantly looking for great sushi/sashimi. I've been here twice and the second time was just to confirm what I'd expected. The first visit was mediocre at best, mostly due to poor service. The 2nd time was this evening.  I arrived during a shift change, or so I thought. Two couples arrived a minute after and sat on opposite sides of me.  After 8 minutes, the server greeted both couples and served water... I'm still waiting and pretty peeved.  I abruptly left.  So, I guess I'm still in the hunt for an authentic sushi bar. Very, disappointed!!

This place is Disgusting!!! Rice is Overcooked, tasted like a baby food  My California Rolls did not even looked like ones. Lunch menu was way too small for the price.  All-You-Can eat was a disaster. It took them 45 min to bring second order of rolls which we could not even eat, because they had NO Taste !!! Service is way too slow as well their chefs which I think would make a much better job cooking Salsa.  Save your time and money and try to stay away from that Sushi JOKE Place!!!

We absolutely adore Moto. Delicious sushi, friendly wait staff, what more do you need? I think the only drawback may be the parking situation, but if you aren't in breakneck heels, you can always find a spot closer to the grocery market. The wings are delicious, the Asian nachos are kinda messy but taste okay, looking forward to trying some other menu items!
MOTO has good PHO but service is a little SLOW. Sushi pretty good. Nice little bar food escape.

Come here once every couple of weeks. Love there classified bowl although it is extremely spicy so beware - they will warn you.  Dane has been my server a few times now and is awesome. The entire staff seems very friendly and will definitely continue to keep coming here.  I miss there all you can eat sushi Saturdays during happy hour.

How this place has even 3.5 stars i will never understand.  Pretty much all of the bad stuff that you read in these reviews is spot on. We used to live not far from this place and so had been there twice before both times the service was painfully slow and the food was mediocre at best. But some time has passed and people kept writing good reviews so we thought "hey why not give them another chance?" the answer is simply, "because they scuk."  Years have passed yet the service is still the worst of any restaurant I have been to in the last 5 years. The waiters pretty much ignore you once you are seated. And once they take your order? Forget about it. Refill on a drink? Forget about it. Don't like how the food tastes? Forget about it. I have only had equally bad sushi at Albertson's. Both the presentation and the flavor seriously left something to be desired. If you're even considering this place for happy hour, let alone dinner ignore the bad reviews at your own risk. I have three words for you- forget about it.

So I have to say, when my friends tried to get me to try and all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant, I wasn't thrilled, but it's awesome!  Moto is a small restaurant in central Phoenix (16th St and Glendale) that offers all-you-can-eat Sushi on Saturday from 11:30am-2:20pm.  And I must say, it's not just California Rolls, the special features some of my favorites; philly, las vegas, tootsy, eel, and much more.  The special is about $17 bucks, which you easily pay for two specialty rolls.  The rules to teh special are cute too, so don't over order because you'll pay 50 cents for each piece left. :-)  Also, make sure you try to Mojo, which is a dessert sushi roll.  It's ice cream (flavor chanegs everyday but we were lucky to get caramel) wrapped lie a sushi roll, but the rice is rice crispy!  Definitely a place to try if you love sushi like I do!

Let's talk about the good things at Moto.  1. Beer. The owner (who splits his time between CO and AZ) doesn't mess around with "typical" beers. You won't find Budweiser, Miller, Coors, Heineken, Corona or any of their "lite" varieties. Usual beers found on tap are from Four Peaks (local brewery), Stone Brewing (San Diego), Avery Brewing (Boulder, CO) and various other craft brewing companies.   Along with the beer comes an in-frequent "beer celebration" held at Moto. This happens for Stone Brewing Anniversaries along with other random events. Usually advertised on tables a few weeks prior to the event.    2. Non-sushi menu items. There is a good selection of pre-made bowls along with a make your own bowl option. I consider all of these bowls to be "to-go" options, I can never finish a full bowl (I'm 6'3" and 200+ lbs, to give you an idea of my size/appetite). Also, the buffalo burger and salmon entrees are good sized and won't break the bank.  I've had every appetizer available on the menu and can say that they are all good to excellent. The spring rolls come with a wonderful sweet sauce. The chicken quesadillas are large and filling. The asian nachos are piled high.   3. Desert - The "Mojos" are probably one of the best frozen deserts I've ever had. Ice cream wrapped in rice crispy treats. The ice cream can change daily, the servers usually do not know what flavor it will be. The menu states this as well.   4. The "Underground" menu. This is the menu of specialty rolls that are made. These clock in at $12 each and are very good. The Jalapenko is spicy and very filling for an 8 piece serving.    5. The "all you can eat" on Saturday. This is both good and bad. The good is that yes, you can get all you can eat (of the available sushi, not everything is on this special). The bad is that once it gets busy you will need to wait for your items, Moto runs two sushi chefs max. If you expect 20 orders of 5+ sushi items to come out in 5-10 minutes, you need to come back to reality. Get there early and order in a timely manner, be prepared.   And now the downside:  1. Sushi - The regular menu has, in comparison to other sushi bars, a very small selection. As mentioned in earlier reviews, only smoked salmon for some items rather than regular salmon. The sushi available is of good size without the "rice bloat" that some sushi bars have, you know what I mean, when the roll has more rice than contents (fish/veggies/seaweed or soy wrap). I recommend ordering a regular roll, such as spicy tuna and an "underground" roll (mentioned above).   2. Wait time and servers - This is a neighborhood restaurant, through and through this is how the owner markets the establishment and runs it. If it is very busy you will need to wait for a table. You will need to wait for your order to be prepared longer if it is busy.    That's all I have to offer you in the way of advice and opinion on Moto. Overall it is above average when factoring in the experience and goal of the restaurant. I wouldn't call it a "sushi experience", but rather a nice sushi restaurant in a good neighborhood. Go to have a nice lunch or dinner, or to watch a game and drink some great beers.

The appetizers were yummy:  Asian Nachos - LOVED IT!  Gyoza - Good  Wonton Soup - 2 wontons and salty soup base  I did not tried the rolls but the girls ordered a Kalifornia and Tootsie   For my entree, I got the sesame chicken with brown rice. I thought the sesame chicken was going to be salt, but it was the sweet sauce coating the fried chicken pieces. It was ok but a little tad sweeter than I like. Everyone had a fun time. I knocked them down to four stars because the service was terrible. We had to flag or get our waitress every time. She never refilled drinks or come back to check on the table. We had to get her attention and sometimes she is no where to be found.

Been going here for years.  The food and service is going downhill.  Last night entrees arrived 15 minutes apart.  Manager who appeared to be about 16 said it was because they have two kitchens? Apparently they don't talk to each other. Avoid
This is some of the most disappointing, poorly prepared, blandest and over-priced sushi/sashimi I've ever had. There was a bone in my salmon sashimi. No plans to return.

Here's the thing... shortly after being seated the waitress spilled an entire pint glass of water DIRECTLY in my lap.  She was extremely embarassed and very apologetic, and I was good natured about the incident because after all, it was just water.  However, what bothered me was the fact that no manager or lead came to the table to apologize or at least buy me a beer.  There are three people at my table cleaning up ice and water, and an hour later I leave your restaurant STILL wet and you can't take a moment to address the situation? It left a bad taste in my mouth.  In addititon, the happy hour menu is rather limited and the sushi isn't bad, but not memorable either.  I'd much rather do happy hour at Ra or some other more consistant establishment.

I was very surprised with the prices. This place is good and the sushi is cheap. The waitress we had gave us what she called the underground sushi menu. These are creative and all sounded good but we had the April roll. Tempura shrimp. real crab, cream cheese, jalapeno, the whole roll was tempura and topped with spicy tuna. OMG freakin awesome, see pic. I liked this roll so much I went back a few days later and got it again. We also had sesame shrimp with noodles and it was delicious. Great food, and great prices. Good atmosphere and friendly staff.

I ordered a Four step entree bowl through Postmates, I asked for crispy tofu and received steamed, there were a few pieces of carrots and broccoli ($2 upcharge) and rice. It was lackluster. I has really hungry and wanted something filling and this did not do it.

Let's put it this way I didn't even leave tip.The only thing that was right was 2 rolls we ordered and the drink order.I've been eating sushi longer than our server has been alive.But for some reason our server felt the need to tell us that nigiri is sushi which I clearly said sushi not rolls nor sashimi.Wont be going back.

Sushi, sushi, sushi. My friend and I stopped in after a fun day of pool crashing at the Biltmore. I ordered an edamame and Las Vegas Roll (my fav.) and she got a double order of sashimi. We were pleased with the fast and attentive service. The food presentation was impressive (beautiful, actually) and the  food was delicious.   I just read someone's review about All You Can Eat Saturdays? I'll have to check that out!  Great job, Moto. We'll be back.

So I'm not changing my stars on this updated review, but I finally came for happy hour. I really did like their happy hour - $5 sushi rolls..What?! They weren't bad either. I had the tootsie roll and the Alaska roll.   I also ordered the crab puffs. I would pass on this. Draft beers are $5. Our bill: 2 rolls, crab puffs, one beer, one wine = $25 excl tip. Not bad, Moto. Not bad.   Service can improve though. Our server sucked.

I have met friends here several times, as it is a centrally located spot for those of us coming from all directions. I would highly recommend the Asian Nachos and any of the beers they offer.  Where Moto falls short is in their wait staff. Every single time I have been here, the wait staff is highly distracted and it takes a long time for them to come check on tables. Is it because they are short staffed or not really interested in customer service? I shouldn't have to wait every visit for my water glass to be refilled. Good food, not so great on the service.

My husband and I, along with our neighbors, have been patrons of Moto for the last five years. Between the six adults, we have had decent experiences and have enjoyed the food. Unfortunately, this evenings experience will likely cause all of us to never return, and tell people not to go.   My husband and two friends went into Moto tonight to grab a drink and food to go. They sat at the bar and were served by Charity. When they walked in they ordered a drink and some sashimi to go. My husbands friend paid for this immediately. They enjoyed their drink and waited for the other to go food they ordered. Charity placed the bill in front of them and the credit card was placed on the bill. The credit card was run and then signed. Charity was tipped. They finished their drink and the food was placed down in front of them. For absolutely no reason, a man, later learned to be Enrique, from behind the bar snatched the food off of the bar stating that they had not paid for the food. When my husband told him they had paid and showed the receipt, Enrique disputed that the signed receipt was for the food that had just been handed to them. Enrique proceeded to go to the other side of the bar with the food that they had already paid for.   During this interaction he was very disrespectful, implying that they were going to walk on the bill. The bill that they had already paid. Charity had to convince Enrique that the bill had been paid before she returned the food. She apologized and said "that was my fault". Charity and Enrique continued to argue as my husband and his friends left.   This was not Charity's fault. Enrique was out of line, disrespectful and blamed paying customers of attempting to steal. Awful.   After they got home, my husbands friend called to speak with a manager or the owner. Enrique answered the call and when my husbands friend indicated he was calling to speak with a manager about this situation, Enrique immediately became defensive. He went so far as to tell my husbands friend to come back to the restaurant to "settle the issue". He refused to put him into a manager or provide the owners information.  They never received an apology from Enrique.  Had Enrique just apologized for the miscommunication between the staff, this review would not have been posted.

I'm disappointed to have to do this, but after a long hiatus I have to conclude that MOTO is not as good as it was when I wrote my rave review.  The mystique of the underground menu is gone. The not-so-underground menu now appears on the back of the regular menu :(  The quality of service and product has also gone down. Sigh.

Great sushi spot in Phoenix. The sushi is very well prepared and tastes delicious! Service is good and the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice and mellow. Also their beer selection is a over average and they change the beer they carry all the time making it fun to try new ones. All in all I would recommend Moto to anyone.

I drive out of my way just to go here. I know a lot of people have had negative experiences but I can only speak to the one item I get, the exit wound bowl. It is really good, very spicy and has a great unique flavor.

The straight dope:  4.5 star bar for hopheads and craft brew fans:  Not particularly extensive in terms of number of offerings, but some sincere thought was put into the list and the result is a spectacular night's worth of excellent brew sampling.  Well done!  It would be nice if they had 12-year Yamazaki single malt to really put the cherry on top of their Japanese theme (even Benihana has that), and that would probably double my frequency of visits, but I guess they have plenty of the ordinary mid to top shelf liquors.     4.25 star ambience/decor.  Dark and modern.  Just how I like it.   4 star sushi/sashimi:  Our party of six tried about six rolls.  Nothing was left on the plates when we were done.  I found the quality to be high, but the execution and taste forgettable.  My wife would certainly disagree - she had the "Senorita Roll" on her mind for many days after we went there, and she went back again 2x over the span of 2 weeks just to get it.  4.25 star dishes and appetizers:  The spicy riblets are INSANE.  One would think that a chef would be a bit fearful of putting something out that is so intentionally overcooked and brittle...but it works!  And I think that is what is special about Moto...the menu has a nice dash of daring, unconventional twists on what could have been (and often is) just very ordinary fare at other places.    PS - the portion sizes of some dishes (like yakisoba) are HUGE - two people could easily be satisfied by one entree here, so if you attend with a group, don't be afraid to "underorder" a bit and to share it family-style.

It isn't easy to find good sushi in Phoenix. Usually, even if you do find it, you have to subject yourself to annoying house beats and dress up like you're going clubbing afterwards to fit in.   Which is why Moto is such an aberration. It's sandwiched between a Blockbuster and McDonalds at 16th St. and Glendale, so the cheezy factor can pretty much be immediately ruled out.   I remember this when it was still a Shogun Express, which I also enjoyed, but I must say, I like Moto even more. They have some creative appetizers including the Asian Nachos, which are essentially nachos with sour cream and chicken and guacamole but instead of tortilla chips, they use fried wontons. Genius, I tell you.   Happy hour prices are more than fair and the Caterpillar and Spicy Tuna rolls are some of the best I've found. Try the all-you-can-eat deal on the weekends, too . . . Hard to beat.

How disappointing!   2 1/2 hrs for lunch really? Poor service and waitress dropped the whole tray of sake and beer on the floor beside us. Then proceeded to clean it up while we sat another 10 mins without drinks.. No manager came by to check on us or bothered to say anything at all. I will be checking this place off my list

We were in Scottsdale for a get away during the week. Daughter's boss meet us there on a Wednesday for lunch. (His recommendation)  Looked like a place for the "cool in the know" sitting in a strip mall area. Found the service to be very good and attentive.Food was excellent ! I had Chinese Chicken salad , half size was enough for two people ,can't imagine what a full order would have been. My daughter had the noodle bowl which again was enough for two people and her partner had fish tacos that was presented very nicely and she stated they were excellent.  Here i was thinking Sushi which i don't eat and it turn out to be a excellent choice by her boss who was" cool and in the know."

I just experienced this restaurant for the second time.  My first time around, the food and service were decent and the nifty sushi dessert made the overall experience pretty cool.   The second time around, it was pretty horrendous.  My boyfriend and I were driving around trying to find a place on which we could both agree.  I was craving sushi, and he's not crazy about sushi.  Ultimately, Moto came to my mind--because they have some basic sushi rolls (although no raw salmon or really much raw nigiri to speak of) along with lots of other food.   So, Moto it was.  On arrival, as we walked up, we noticed a couple of empty tables inside so we weren't too worried about having to wait.  But, when we got inside, the host basically just pointed at a table at the bar, had us sit down, and then threw two menus onto the table and walked away.   As we sat at a table in the bar area--although we wanted to eat in the actual restaurant area--my boyfriend immediately noticed that the couple sitting behind us was completely hammered.  I listened for a moment, and indeed, they were screaming.  Screaming their conversation.  And they were discussing herpes sores.  They appeared to be on a date, discussing herpes sores, and the female occasionally mentioned her DAUGHTER.    So after listening to some loud herpes convo for a few moments, my boyfriend went and asked the host if they had a different table, inside the actual restaurant portion.  We were added to a list.    About 5 minutes later, a waitress approached, and I'm 99.9% sure that she was intoxicated.  Not just slightly inebriated, either, but kind of ridiculous drunk.  She looked all glazed over as she asked if we wanted any drinks.  I asked if they had a drink menu and she stared at me like she was really confused.  Then I asked if they had a cocktail menu, and she said, no, we have a menu of beer and wine.  She gave me a weird look.  So, thinking I was mistaken about the drink situation, I asked, do you guys have a full bar?   She said, oh, yes!  What do you like!?!?  I like fruity drinks, so I asked if they had Stoli Razzberri (or however it's spelled).  She said, "I LOVE THAT.  THAT'S MY FAVORITE."  Then she informed me that she wasn't sure if they had it, but she would check.  My boyfriend (who was driving) requested a water, and the waitress walked away.   Eventually after enduring more conversation about that chick's kid and various human ailments (herpes, chicken pox, the flu), the host told us they had a table for us.  He walked us to the table and threw menus on it.  As he started to walk away, I mentioned to him that I had ordered a drink from the waitress at the other table and I didn't want her to wonder where we went.  He said he'd already told her about it, and not to worry.  A few seconds later, he brought the drink over and set it down.  Oddly, the drink was pink, and a Stoli Razz & tonic isn't usually pink.  But I figured it looked interesting so I'd give it a shot anyway.    Shortly thereafter, our actual waitress approached.  She immediately started LECTURING us about how we can't just order drinks at the bar and walk away without cashing out at the bar.  She went on for a while about how we needed to go back and cash out at the bar.  We explained that we never meant to sit at the bar, and that we had just gotten our drink at our actual table, and hadn't received it at the bar.  So then she kind of backed off after saying something weird, like, "Oh, so you just got them?  Oh, okay, then you guys aren't too worried about it then I guess."  Then she started telling me about the drink I'd received, which wasn't the one that I ordered--it was some other type of vodka with actual fruit in it or something.  Then she gave me a long list of all the other types of fruit vodkas that they have.  I guess that was ok, and the drink ended up being pretty decent.  But it was still just....bizarre.   Anyway, we ordered our food.  That included a shrimp tempura roll, a squid salad, a regular sized order of the asian nachos, and a buffalo burger.    The shrimp tempura roll and squid salad came out first.  I'm an idiot who's terrible with chopsticks, and I didn't notice that we had no forks until the waitress was gone.  It took a while to obtain a fork.  But anyhow, the squid salad was pretty decent, typical for any sushi restaurant.  The roll was....ok.  The crab mix in it was kind of like what you could get in a crab salad sandwich at Subway.  It also had carrots in it, which were kind of overwhelming.    Then, out came the asian nachos.  The gigantic asian nachos.  She brought us a large instead of the regular that I ordered, and of course, charged us for the large.  I considered saying something, but I figured we'd just get a lecture.  We were only able to finish a small portion of them, because the large was freaking huge.  Fortunately they were good.    Maybe we misread, but the buffalo burger was made with buffalo, not buffalo sauce.    Moto is not very good.

First off let me say this, I came back to this place for its wings and sushi. We walked in and greeted by the bartender, she sat us in her section.
