Mine you she is super busy, ( I have a habit of paying attention to things going on around me) we placed our started right away with her with 2 waters while we looked at the menu. I noticed the wings we ordered sat in the window, she pushes them aside to make our drinks, two other people including what I believe was the manager, guy finally helped the bartender get water for guest coming in. While the other young lady/server pushed our wings to the side and proceeded to grab food behind the wings and take the food to the assign table/person. What pissed me off was why not help each other and deliver the food. When our wings did reach our table, they arrived COLD!!!! I sent it back, and decided to cancel my whole order. I'm writing this review so the employees at this establishment see it, and work to make things right. Help each other out when it's busy. Don't lose customers!! You sure did lose 2 today!!! I will not be coming back.

We went out and got the happy hour and Mike was helping us at the bar. He was friendly attentive and funny   We had Philly roll, salmon sashimi, and the spicy salmon roll. We like salmon.   Basically I come here and sometimes have a bad experience but Mike totally changed that. He was a great bartender.

This Business has been my go to Sushi restaurant for some time now. It's a small quaint establishment. The food is good and and they have a great selection for everyone...even if you don't like sushi. The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because sometimes the food does take a little to long to get to you, and the business  it self is kind of small. There isn't a lot of seating especially when it's busy.  Otherwise, I enjoy eating here and will continue to frequent Moto.
The best, freshest sushi in Central Phoenix! Service is always great and staff friendly. Sushi Happy Hour is rather short and limited but I hear the AYCE is fantastic.

The single most disgusting sushi experience I've ever had. Asian nachos were burned and tasteless, April and Toosties rolls were totally bland and the texture was way off, the crab wontons came with some funky nasty sauce.. Blahhhh. $50 down the toilet.

I used to live right around the corner from this little treat, luckily it is close to work so we can still conveniently enjoy it!   The ironic part of Moto for me, I absolutely LOVE sushi but I order other items on the menu here because they are so freakin' tasty. Two of my favorites include the Moto Chicken Salad (cabbage, chicken, peanuts, celery, green onion tossed in a light sesame vinagrette) and comes in 2 sizes - regular and large. The large is huge - fyi!  The chicken teriyaki bowl is so "clean" - excellent pieces of all-white meat, no chewy surprises... with your choice of white or brown rice. I like the brown rice. The sauce is a sweeter version of teriyaki, but great consistency. Avoid the miso soup - just one salty mess.   Randomly tried their dessert, called "Mojos" - and they really brought out the "fat kid" in me!!! These rolls consist of Nutella, brownie and ice-cream rolled out with a layer of rice krispie treat and then sliced. Gotta atleast try them once!   Great little neighborhood joint. Spent many a night drinking wine on the adorable little patio area.

I have been here several times now and have never had a bad experience yet.  Good food, good service; no complaints.   Still have never made it here for happy hour, but their specials during that time seem like quite a deal.  The staff are always friendly and seem to remember us from one visit to another.  I've only ever eaten sushi here, but they have a lot of other menu items that I would like to try at some point, but I always turn to the sushi as it has always been good and fresh.  I would recommend trying this restaurant.

These awful reviews are hilarious. I've been in the service industry over 10 years and I find the blatant honesty of the "you order it to pay for it" to be exactly what all restaurants should do. Unless there is something extremely wrong with your food item, (which there has never been at Moto for me) then eat it and stop looking for a free meal. Moto has my favorite happy hour in all of Phoenix. Constantly fantastic beer selections and the service has always been great. At times slow, but always very polite. Also, those of you reading too much into the signage out front, get a life.

I've got to say these other reviews are absolutely absurd. After meeting the owner and talking to the bartenders/servers this place is a gem to find this sort of quality and pricing. The food here is absolutely phenomenal and the staff is very friendly and willing to accommodate any sort of requests you have within reason. The beer selection alone is worth bragging about and the prices are cheap compared to the other places charging you over $10 a beer. So if you're looking for a place with amazing beer and cocktails and quality food this is the place you're looking for. Please don't go off these other reviews that some people want to put down for this amazing restaurant. Please appreciate quality food and beverages without all the other bullshit.

Nice little place, great decor and the food was awesome!  Tried 3 sushi rolls: spicy salmon, spicy tuna and tootsie.  For dinner entree I got their chicken katsu, probably the best I've ever had...light and crispy.  Their Asian slaw is phenomenal.  Portion size is HUGE... The server, Suzanne is so attentive and cordial.

Just got back from Moto, and my wife is taking a Benadryl and having an allergic reaction because they contaminated her food with shrimp even after she told them she has an allergy.  When our food came out, the rolls were on the same plate (I had shrimp), so my wife apologized for the problem but let the waitress know that cross-contamination was a concern. The waitress took the rolls away, but them brought the same ones back on separate plates while assuring us that the staff had changed gloves in between making them, and that there was no way there would be an issue.  We left after being chastised by management for not explicitly stating there was an allergy problem when we placed our order (we made the mistake of being first-time customers and not knowing that things come out plated together). Apparently its not good enough to try to clarify when the food arrives. The manager told us it was our fault for not telling the waitress at the time we placed our order, and indicated that they refuse to remake rolls when there is an allergen concern.  So, we got blamed for my wife's allergic reaction, and the food wasn't even good. Even without this terrible customer service and allergy issue, we wouldn't consider going back.
Asian Nachos, Exit Wound Bowl and a great beer selection. We come here every week and its definitely a unique place. If you're craving a little fusion try this place out!

I have loved this place since the underground menu was actually something secret and cherished. I get why you shared it, I'm Still so OG I took a photo of the paper version! Took a friend for his first and it was awesome! Jalapenko roll and Volcano are favs. To the yelp haters (the best part is where they call you out on the menu!) Did you try it more then once? Where you pissed because it was busy? Did your handcrafted sushi take to long? Go to revolving sushi then! This place is worth a forty mile drive for a friends first time sushi! Try the Mojo's your inner fat kid will thank you! If you don't like fish why are you here? Moto on!  I'll keep coming long as I'm in state and I love breaking in sushi virgins here! Tess was amazing! If you think you can handle hot order mustard gas and tell us about it in your review!

Menu and prices look great, but no vegan sauce options for the 4-step entrées (bowls/plates) or noodle dishes. :( Everything is chicken stock based, except the curry, which is vegetarian and made with dairy cream instead of coconut milk (yuck!). Was really hoping for a new noodle spot. Bummer.

came for the bourbon and will be back for the food. The Jalapanko roll is stupid good. Cant wait to have it again. The philly was just ok to me but my wife really like the freshness and the taste. Little dry to me and my daughter ordered cali rolls everywhere and she needed something to dip it into.  My cousin ordered the Moto wings with the gas mustard sauce for an appetizer for us and if you like spicy you will like it, it is spicy, he always orders the hottest thing on the menu and always tells them to make it as hot as they can.. He also ordered The Classified bowl and didnt have to say anything about making it hot and it ended up being the hottest dish he has ever had. So good job MOTO !! .. I tried a few pieces and it had some great flavor. If you think you like spicy then try this and maybe you wont anymore.. spiciest dish in arizona. to top it off for the 5 stars was the service. Great!

I will begin by saying that I've been wanting to try this place for months now, simply because they have a salad that bears my name. Which reminds me of my high school days, when the internet was new and I spent an afternoon with a friend visiting websites that also had our name. Most ended up being adult sites, but tonia.com* was an Asian company that had my name written in a fantastic logo. I wonder what it means.   Anywho, not only does the salad live up to its given name, but Moto is now on my backup sushi rotation. Reasonably priced and of good quality, I was extremely full by the time I ate only half of my dinner. The Tonia salad I actually had for lunch a day later, and was very filling and delicious. I can only imagine what it would've been like eating it the same night. Had it not been as great, I would've never came back and written to the owners, demanding the salad change to a lesser awesome name, maybe one more common or boring.  My to go order was ready exactly when they said it would and I was in and out the door in minutes. I'll be back.  *I have no idea if this is still the same site anymore. I am not responsible for where the link leads.. now.. or in the future
Las Vegas roll was so AMAZING!!! There was another one that was kind of sweet caramel kind of thing that had sesame seeds so, so GOOD!!!  So worth the drive from the west Soooo Worth It!!!

I've been on a hiking kick lately and am trying to find different ones to try.  Decided to try Piestewa Peak (or Squaw Peak depending on who you ask) but was going to meet up with a friend for lunch beforehand and we found Moto not too far away.  I got there first, a little before 11 which is when they open.  There were a couple people waiting but nothing outrageous.  I walk in and get acknowledged right away by the bartender who lets me know that someone will be right up to seat me and sure enough, as he was finishing that statement the waitress came over and took me to a table.  She also brought me water right away which always makes me happy.  While I was waiting for my friend to show up I read over the menu and was super excited to find out that not only do they have All You Can Eat Sushi, but that it was happening RIGHT AT THAT MOMENT!!  Apparently it's on Saturdays from 11-2:30 and there's 10 different rolls you can choose from for $18.99 (there are some nigiri options too but I don't remember how many there were to choose from for those).  Once my friend showed up I quickly told him about the All You Can Eat special so then he perused the menu to see which ones he wanted.  Our waitress kind of went MIA at this point so that was a little annoying but she seemed to be the only server there so I can't fault her for that but seriously you would think that the management there would keep the place a little bit better staffed on a weekend day during an all you can eat special.  Once our waitress came by for our order my friend got the Tootsi Roll, the Vegas Roll and the Alaska Roll.  I decided that I probably didn't want to binge on sushi right before a hike so I stuck with a single Rainbow Roll.  They took a little bit of time to come out but then again sushi typically does and I'm sure everyone who was in the restaurant was ordering tons of different rolls.  I was happy with the size, the rolls were larger than most places but not so huge that you had a hard time eating a piece.  My Rainbow Roll was delicious!  All the ingredients were fresh and beautiful.  I'll admit I did share one piece of my friend's Vegas Roll (sharing is against the rules according to the menu...oops!) and it was pretty good.  Not the best Vegas Roll I've had but still good.  I'll definitely be coming back here again on another Saturday when I don't plan on hiking so that I can actually partake in the All You Can Eat!

I will really miss the Asian Nachos, they've always been my favorite - been dining here for years, but I will never be back. Our spicy yellowtail roll tasted so fishy that it was inedible, but the chef said it was not his problem because he just made it yesterday. That's hilarious, right? Because, he was serious and the poor waitress had to deliver the good news.  I know the owners don't care about this review, as it clearly states on the menu: Which is just  as funny as two-day-old sushi. If only your service was as good as your ego is big, your Yelp reviews wouldn't suck.

I'm only giving this 2 stars because of the horrible service I had on Saturday.    My bf and I decided to have a date day filled with sushi and a movie.  We arrived at Moto and were seated promptly at a table by the bar.  The restaurant wasn't packed at all and we seemed to arrive at just the right time.  Our server, Lilia didn't great us for nearly 5 minutes then she took almost 10 minutes to bring us our iced teas.  She took our order of the all you can eat sushi and it wasn't too long before our sushi came out.  She never once came back in the middle of our meal to see how the sushi was and showed up as I was consuming my last piece of sushi.  Normally, the servers will come back a few minutes after dropping off the first round of sushi and from there they will take your next order to make sure you get prompt service.  Just as I was eating my last piece of sushi she showed up and took our second order.  Our ice teas were low and she never offered to refill them.  We were watching the time and noticed our movie was starting within 40 minutes so we were a little concerned.  After sitting there for 20 minutes after putting in our second order, we asked the bartender if we had an order waiting for us.  He informed us she put it in but it wasn't up yet.  Lilia was literally wondering around aimlessly and didn't look that busy so we were a little upset that she was giving us horrible service.  She finally decided to come over and give us an ETA of when our last order would be up and we asked for our bill so we could pay and leave after we ate.  We let her know we still wanted our last order but we were just trying to make a movie.  She grabbed us our bill then came back and took our plates and cleaned off the table.  We were absolutely confused and asked the bartender about our order.  He told us that she cancelled our last sushi order and we informed the bartender that we didn't tell her to do that.  At this point we were fuming mad and just ready to leave because I knew if I had spoken to the manager I would've blown up.  On top of that we missed our movie and just decided to go home.  We spent $49.70 on sushi and that included a 20% gratuity tip that they automatically put on for the all you can eat sushi.  She honestly wasn't worth the $8.28 tip that I was forced to pay.  I seriously feel like I've been ripped off and the server received a 20% tip for pretty much doing nothing.  I come here all the time and I've never had bad service like this before.  The girls are normally attentive and want to turn their tables so they make more money, which makes sense.  This was the second time Lilia was our server and both times we had horrible service.  The first time we let slide because it was a Friday night and they were doing their local brews so they were slammed.  I just thought she was overwhelmed the first time and I didn't let it bother me.  But to have poor service from the same girl twice in a row is unacceptable.    Overall, the food was excellent, the bartender was more attentive to us than our server, I just wish I could've enjoyed more.

I loveee happy hour at this place. Good beers and the happy hour sushi/appetizers menu is awesome! Brought a friend here who did not like sushi, but had some of the Asian chicken nachos and loved them (they are pretty freakin' fabulous). I haven't had anything here that wasn't awesome.

Irreverent and original, be prepared for some unique interpretations of your asian classics. While there are the traditional sushi and sashimi, there are also fun rolls, usually with a spicy twist.  And then they have the most awesome Asian dessert - "Mojo's"!! (ice cream sushi rolls). Be sure to save room!

If you eat in sushi does still take awhile on occasion. The service is usually decent although not overly friendly either.  They have decent vegan options and I must say the portions are rather large. When we wanted a basic tofu/rice/veggies bowl we started getting take out here rather then Pei Wei or other pseudo asian joints because; it's cheaper, it tastes better and for under $6 you get a large bowl that is plenty for 1.5 meals. I have never even gotten the "plate" size because the bowl is always so large.   I usually get the brown rice bowl with fried tofu, add veggies and the curry or chile sauce. Once in awhile I will mix it up and do noodles instead which is good as well.  It's a decent place to pop in for a drink and a bite to eat, sometimes can get busy but it's good to have places like this in the neighborhood (plus it's not a chain - bonus).

I have never eaten inside the place but I may go for the AYCE thing on a Saturday.   I've ordered take out on a few occasions and really liked it. I am a very judgmental sushi eater! I love unagi and the flavor has to be just right! So the dragon rolls to have impressed me is a big deal. I also ordered the tuna tataki that just wasn't seasoned as well as other places but overall enjoyable. The chicken katsu is very tasty, panko breading makes anything good though, and comes with asian slaw that isn't overly tart  and the brown rice was cooked well. My son loves those desert rolls, the little fatty!   I've ordered by phone and gone in to order and either way the staff has been friendly and helpful.   I like this place and even though I have moved farther from this place than other sushi restaurants I will continue to go there until I am thoroughly disappointed.

I want to give this place a five star because i love the food, verity and ambiance however the young servers are giving consistent poor service. I was there for dinner and we were sat in a semi full restaurant at the back table by the bathroom. When our female server showed up and we asked if we could be moved she seemed irritated and said "sure" and walked away. We had to grab our own menus and go ask another server to be relocated. Food was fantastic As always but our new server never cleared our plates and so we kept moving them to the table next to us. When she brought our check we had plates stacked on both tables.  My opinion is that the younger generation providing the service have never really paid or gone out for dinners that they are paying for themselves and are clueless on etiquette, timing and customer service.  They need basic 101 training.  The "riblets on the menu are amazing!! If you do go, the menu is very entertaining so be sure to take a good read of it!!

I'll admit I really have never loved this place until now!  Lived down the street since before they opened. They have the best rotating IPA selection in town. IPAs you won't get anywhere else in town. Sushi is great too but combine their beer selection with the food and it's my new local place.

Mediocre to the max with bad service to boot!   I've given this place a handful of tries and I just can't seem to find anything I like. The service is probably the worst part. Waiting 10 minutes for sushi rolls that are clearly ready and waiting to be served is not acceptable. I feel bad for the waitresses - every time I am in they seem to be running around like crazy.    The food is pretty horrible too. I CAN say the Asian chicken salad is pretty good but the rice bowls and sushi are all not good.
Excellent food, great happy hour, and Caitlin, Sarah and Jesse are fabulous servers.

The staff was very rude, messed up an order and ignored me or passed off responsibility to several other employees for over 10 minutes while I tried to get someone to fix it. One employee interrupted me several times when I tried to explain what was missing. Ended up leaving with the wrong order.
First don't tell me I can't sit in the booth when no one is in the restaurant. Service was horrible, we ended up walking out.

Moto is one of the few sushi places near DT that I know of...on top of it being centrally located, it also has some pretty damn good sushi!  I have not been too adventurous with the menu...I normally always get the standard (a sake bomber, edamame, a roll, and some sashimi) but my co-diner decided to be gutsy and try  "The Exit Wound" is possibly the hottest noodle bowl in the Southwest...so watch out!  After that bowl, cool off with their ice cream sushi...it's two or sometimes three different types of ice cream (it's always a surprise and they won't tell you ahead of time what type of ice cream they are using for the night) and then rolled in rice crispies...definitely yummy.  Two chopsticks up! :)

I was really excited about Moto, so my Mom and I checked it out.  Bleh.   The sushi was just not good... not like stinky-ew-terrible, but mediocre. Our server was pretty young and confused about the whole serving profession.  I give it two stars because I can see myself cruising to the bar for a midday beer and chowing down on some edamame, as it's a really neat area.

Sushi is delicious and not unreasonably priced. I wouldn't say its the best sushi I've ever had but its definitely quality and the prices, atmosphere and selection definitely mske up for it. The entire restaurant has a sense of humor and the staff is generally pretty friendly.   North central Phoenix also lacks some good bars but Moto's definitely stands out if you're looking to get some drinks as well. Definitely recommend it.

Very yummy, my favorite roll is the Las vegas, and here they make a good one and it's 1/2 off during happy hour. I keep meaning to come for the all you can eat sushi! Try the Ice Cream sushi roll, this is one of the only places I know that does it and it is delicious!
It hits home! I liked the flavor of the pad thai and the spring roll. I thought it was really nice and flavorful. Huge servings and friendly staff. This visit is 5star rated for me.

Surprised that I loved this place.  Haven't been a big sushi fan in the past, but this place may change that.  Plenty of vegan options.  Service was quick, although not personable.  Bathrooms were clean, customers seemed happy, and the ambiance was better than average.  Will definitely try again soon.

My friend and I stopped in here for a quick drink and appetizer before our nail appointment on a Saturday afternoon. They had friendly staff and happy hour from 11-6:16, so score! I got a Moscow mule and she got a mojito. Both were fresh and delicious! We also got the bún bo edamame (don't try these on a first date) that were covered in a yummy Vietnamese sauce/spices. We also got the spring rolls. We will definitely come back to try more!

Love this place, we have been coming here almost every 2 weeks. Service is amazing food is great. We got fried spring rolls and our favorite Moto wings. Then we had a big plate of avocado rolls, rainbow, Las Vegas and spicy tuna rolls. And if you have not tried before you should definitely try their ice cream mojos.

Been coming here for years for lunch, happy hour, dinner. Long been a fan of the variety of spring rolls and noodle bowls. Also like appys like the riblets and wings.  Good beer selection, though today they have not a single Asian beer available.  An Asian restaurant without Asian beer??? Unthinkable.

We eat at Moto 3-4 times a year.  We've always been happy with the food, service and prices. Our last visit was about 2 weeks ago;  we ordered all 5 rolls on the happy hour menu,  wine and beer.  Service was prompt, the drinks and rolls came lickety split and all was fresh and flavorful.  Leftovers were cheerfully boxed and just as tasty for the next day's lunch.  My favorite part of Moto is that the rolls are a little skinnier than most others and therefore it's easier to eat one entire piece at a time without cutting it or biting in half.  Manageable bite sized pieces.  The dessert roll is always a hit.  We'll go back.
They have a good happy hour on Sundays. Sushi is pretty good but I didn't like the nachos.
Moto does everything good, but it never rises to great. They have an eclectic menu and there's tons for non-sushi eaters, too. Good value for dollar spent and usually walk away full and happy.

Solid happy hour, 1/2 off rolls and select apps and $3 beers. They extend happy hour until 6:15 and that extra 15 minutes really helps when you are rushing after work.   I liked the spring rolls and the tootsie roll was decent too. The bar is big and we easily found a seat but it tends to fill up fast after 5.  Not the best sushi in the world but the happy hour prices can't be beat.

The sushi was acceptable. The service is awful. We waited 15 min to get menus. Another 10-15 to have our order taken and then it took a good 30 min to get our food. We weren't in a hurry or we would have left. The place had about 20 people inside with 3 servers, so unless the servers were also doing the cooking there is no reason it should have taken this long. The location was far from "busy" but that was the excuse used over and over. I would recommend one of the other many sushi restaurants in town. Or perhaps, heading to Fry's on Tatum and Shea. They have better service and better sushi.
Great atmosphere, good music, relaxing--can be pricey but worth it. Asian nachos are the best--will be back.
Awesome inexpensive happy hour. The food is tasty - not just sushi. Great place to just hang out for awhile.

Not that this place was ever even a 4 star establishment, but even my last review and rating is too good for what I recently experienced. Went for lunch and was "greeted" by a yell from some guy behind the bar telling me to sit wherever I wanted to. After my lunch companion arrived we retrieved our own menus and sat down. Again a yell from behind the bar wanting to know if we wanted water to drink. I ordered the panic shrimp x 2 ($4.50 each) and a wonton soup. She ordered the chicken caesar salad. The place had maybe 6 people dining and at least that many employees all congregated behind the bar. Eventually our food came. The shrimp are large shrimp that someone has beaten the hell out of until they are paper thin and then deep fried. They were warm, not hot, and very greasy. The wonton soup was almost tasteless. Watered down chicken broth (most likely from a can) and 3 soggy wontons. The wontons were unseasoned and the texture mealy. I gave up at this point and cut my losses with the disappointing appetizers. I was told the chicken caesar salad was acceptable, but nothing that you couldn't get at any other fast food joint. Overall very disappointing and we will most likely never return.

This was my first time at Moto, but I had been wanting to try it, so I read the Yelp reviews to know what to expect. Pretty much this place gets good reviews for food and dinged on the service. I have to say both were awesome on my visit. My server/bartender was Rebecca and she was knowledgable about the beer and food, as well as friendly. She made suggestions about what to try, but only based on my preferences, and never pushy. I don't eat a lot of sushi but I was very satisfied with my Las Vegas roll. Rebecca did admit that it was only her second day (never would have guessed) so I'm hoping that means the owners are taking action on the previously bad service reviews. I will certainly eat there again.

This restaurant would've received four stars because the chicken red curry was spicy and tasty, the happy hour cocktail was great, and the edamame was perfectly salted. And even though our server was a newbie, she was still attentive and got answers to all our happy hour and menu Qs.  Unfortunately, none of this matters because I got food poisoning. I'm guessing from the chicken because no one else in my party got ill and I was the only one who ordered chicken. Worst 48 hours of my life. I'll never return.

I love this place. The food is always delicious. I came for lunch today and had Pho which was as good as any Vietnamese place I've gone to. I don't know my waitresses name but she was adorable, extremely nice and attentive. Dinner can get very busy and the wait times can get long, but it's worth it.

I've been here a few times for happy hour, but this was my first dinner experience. I would say overall for a happy hour meal it's a solid 3 stars. Great deals on beer, and average rolls that'll appease a craving.   The dinner experience is more deserving of 2 stars, but I rounded up. The quality of the food doesn't align with their regular prices.  We ordered Gyoza to start. The skin was soft and steamed but it was the blandest little bugger I've had, and it was slightly cold. I then ordered the Lemongrass Pork and I got really confused. It was supposed to be a noodle dish, but it was 60% iceberg lettuce, the pork was super dry as well. At least what few noodles I had were good and I liked the sauce.  Nick wasn't impressed with his dish either. Too little shrimp, not enough spice. The bartender was such a sweetheart though, and the beers were good. Oh well, sometimes a place is only meant for happy hour visits (shoulder shrug).
Great happy hour.  Order the Asian Nachos.  They are so addicting!  Mmmmmmm...
If you are Coming here because the sushi, go somewhere else. Not much options on the menu and sloppy sushi. What they call specials, it's is a regular option anywhere else.

I have been to this location several times and they have been very helpful ( im deaf ) and kind. Once they made a mistake and compensated for that mistake greatly!!  The sushi is excellent! Prices can be a bit on the high side but the great food makes up for it. I highly recommend this restaurant for great sushi .
i have not been here in a while but when i did go the food was rather good not too expensive at all i would return to this location

Ordered their Pho and it was good- the flavor was amazing but it had grilled chicken which made it a bit dry.  However, we also had sushi and the squid salad and it was fabulous!!!  Would highly recommend

The people who regularly patronize Moto must not have jobs, or lives, or children, or pets, because if they did, they would constantly be late to everything they did, have a pissed off babysitter, and dead animals littering their house.  I am extremely understanding and very forgiving, but when it takes over 45 minutes to bring me avocado rolls, when it really isn't busy, there is something way wrong. Like wayyyy wrong.  I had the miso soup. Didn't like it. Once I finally got the avocado rolls, they were really good, but I was so annoyed that I could barely enjoy them. I also had to ask several times to get my tea refilled.  The location is good, my sushi was good and reasonably priced, and the decor is pretty cool, so I am going to give them three stars, but the service was so terribly slow I feel like being served by a sloth would have been more efficient.

Moto is pretty high up there in the sushi world for me. I love my sushi so it take a good place to impress me.   I first went to Moto for their All-You-Can-Eat Saturdays. IN the beginning it wasn't nearly as strict as it is now, but rightfully so they had to implement some rules(Don't be a gluten, no sharing, $0.50 per piece you have leftover that they will box up for you to take home, must eat all the rice as well...). They offer just about any kind of sushi you would want for about $18 per person, or $22 per person if you want Saki with it, still a fab deal!   My other favorite there is their chicken terriacki bowl, probably the best I have had in a long time. They have a "built your own" style bowl menu, very good, check it out!   Over all Moto is good, but a once in awhile venture.

Oh Moto how I love  thee!   Let it be known I like sushi, Pad Thai etc but it isn't my go to meal. In other words, it has to be really delicious for me to partake in such foods. I'll tell you...Moto Sushi has incredible food, service, and a chill/inviting vibe. The menu is brilliantly creative with items that will please the biggest sushi fan down to the pickiest of eaters. My favorite menu items are the pad Thai with shrimp, the Asian nachos, and the Moto chicken salad (ahhh I want some now!!). They also have things like chicken wings, quesadillas, noodle dishes, create your own bowl, fried tofu, and lots of other wonderful dishes. The food travels well so it's perfect to pick up and also great for leftovers the next day.   If you dine in you'll notice the service is very friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. Another perk of dining in is the vast array of their specialty cocktails and small dishes available to you at happy hour (saving money...jackpot)! I haven't actually had a drink here, but they all look quite tasty, so I look forward to doing so. The prices are mid range and reasonable for the portion sizes and quality of food. Every dollar spent at Moto is totally worth it.   Whenever I want good sushi and noodles I head to Moto. They have incredible food, friendly people, and a hip and happening atmosphere. You've got to check this place out, it's the best!

I love this place and go there like a regular. It is not a typical sushi bar. My gf hates sushi and one side of their menu is dedicated to the "non sushi" person. It is a very stylish upscale but not pricey place. All the waitresses are super cool and quite sexy too. I see lots of families there and the regulars really are regular..whether at the bar or table they have a great selection of imported beer. maybe I think of it as a neighborhood sushi place.

I have been here three times, and each time the service was incredibly bad. I thought it might get better, but now I'm too frustrated to return. The sushi is fine and near my house- but I won't be a patron of this place again. Incredibly disappointed. I had to debate with a server about pricing when I ordered off the happy hour menu. Even on my final bill, she did not give me the correct pricing. I saw it and ordered it off the happy hour menu within the happy hour window. I don't understand the confusion. By the time I got the incorrect bill, it was too much effort to push the matter further. I just paid and left feeling totally bummed about what was supposed to be a yummy treat and break from my busy day. I will not be returning.

I am not much of a sushi fan usually but I thought this place was pretty good. I was really happy that they had more than the typical sapporo, asahi, kirin beers that you find at every sushi place but had a small number of american microbrew beers also.  They have a Saturday lunchtime all you can eat deal for $19 that can't be beat. The only reason I am not giving it 4 or 5 stars is the service wasn't very attentive and the regular prices are a little high.

probably the ONLY place i'm a regular.  have really only had their tofu bowls. i only have lunch here and i never feel like trying anything new.   their bowls are great. choose your "meat". the way you want it cooked - i prefer garlic and broccoli. white or brown rice. add veggies for a $1 more.   i dont know if i would recommend any sushi from here. had a spicy tuna once. dont remember it. so it must have not been that good.   they have this dessert thats pretty good.

What?? No raw salmon? Only smoked?I am tres cornfused. Am I at a bagel place or a sushi restaurant?  Slow service. Limited sushi menu. Bland Miso.  NO RAW SALMON.  Enough said, I won't be back. Too bad it was my only Saturday sushi lunch option (Zen 32, I'm looking in your direction...).

Papa Trans Riblets are to die for! Moist, flavorful, get me a side of rice and ranch dipping sauce and I'm in heaven! If I could eat these for breakfast lunch and dinner I would, we drive 55 miles to eat these bad boys! Hint: order the large size and don't share because seriously even if your full you can still eat more! My mouth is watering now for Papa Trans Riblets! Ok gotta go !

Love love love the curry soup here  My boyfriend and I love coming here Charity is awesome...she always remembers what we like  Definitely recommend curry soup and bar wings  There's nothing I haven't liked here  Rolls are a good size

I've been going to Moto ever since they opened. I don't go anywhere else for sushi in Phoenix. They have great specialty rolls and standard rolls and they're very reasonably priced. I also discovered the curry soup there and it's FANTASTIC. The staff is very friendly and on one visit a server I had frequently knew I had a horrible day, and she brought me a glass of wine on the house. I really think this place is exceptional. Great food, great staff, great environment. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Good customer service. Saw other reviews that they didnt like customer service. Seems they have changed that! Decent happy hour. Excellent wings....! Good sushi. Very different beer menu!

Decent sushi, I prefer to sit up at the bar counter.  I went there for lunch the other day by myself and it was fast service but there were tons of "regular" types in there drinking and chatting up the staff.  It made me wonder why they were just hanging out on a week day in the middle of the afternoon...but they are lucky I guess. Oh the food: I started with miso soup and edamame (both hard to mess up), they were good. I ordered a tempura shrimp roll...it was okay, the end pieces had the parts you don't eat so there were only like four pieces.  Overall it was okay and one of the only sushi places by my office (now that I work nearby) so I'll probably be back.  I'm open to recommendations...but I've definitely been to plentyyyy of better sushi spots.  Ohhh and the parking lot is a nightmare -- whether you're trying to run into Subway or Moto this shopping center is sheer chaos during lunch especially.

I've been coming here for years. I love this place. It is a small dim friendly restaurant. You can enjoy a nice dinner with the family or meeting people by the bar on a night out with the girls. Staff is great. You can find the owner there often meeting people. They all make you feel welcome and wanting to come back for more.

Have been to this spot several times. Always recommend it to others However last time I was here I had a very frustrating experience as far as service. The food has always been very pleasant and good. However our waitress served our table appetizers all at different times, martinis in wine glasses (?!) entrees at least 10 minutes apart, then to top it off, my cousin who was visiting me and was off duty from the military had a very bad dish.  After speaking with the general manager about a few of the frustrations throughout our meal, she did comp the food, which was very nice as we did not expect this. I would still recommend this place as it has a very casual ambiance and great dishes however I think the staff is where the fault is and if you don't mind drinking sake out of a plastic cup.

I really like Moto!  I find their sushi a little on the pricey side but everything else seems to be of good value. My favorite thing to get is there a "bowl" let's you pick what kind of meat, what kind of vegetable, what type of rice, and what kind of sauce you want to have. Teriyaki and curry are my favorite options. They have good salads and one of my favorite things is their version of a shrimp tacos. Yummy! Lots of good offerings here, with friendly service and nice atmosphere. Plus, it amuses me that they have rules about cell phones ringing and touching their curtains, LOL

Recently discovered by the Canadians, Moto roughly translated means "don't eat sushi here, but everything else on the menu is great!"  My first visit to Moto was several years ago when I had some sushi and sashimi items. My most vivid memory was ordering a Philadelphia roll and watching the sushi guy take an already made roll off the counter and cut it into pieces and serve it to me. I'm sorry, has that been there long?   Flash forward to a month ago when my parents were at Matsuri and wanted a "Japanese" meal. I recommended Moto because it was the only place I thought would be open at 2PM on a Saturday. I was drawn to revisit it because they offer some interesting beer selections on draught. Well, they do, and it exposed me to a couple of interesting beers I'd not heard of. My folks wanted to order sushi, so I let them, and sure enough the rolls they ordered, as well as my sashimi selections were just not very good. Everyone at the table ordered entrees and we were all very happy. The build your own noodle bowls are great. I have been back a couple times since and really enjoy it every time.   The service here has been great every visit with a staff of girls all in their twenties that are hip, but not in an asinine way that some of these other types of places can be. Try getting a twenty something girl to show you any respect at Stingray, RA, etc. Ain't gonna happen, friend. I'm also impressed that they offer a great happy hour, especially Sunday when it is all day long.   Yep, Moto is a great place, as long as you don't order the sushi. The menu items are too good to pass up to order something that is sub-par or average.
I love Moto, always quality food. Great sushi, spring rolls, and the rice bowls are awesome. They also added the Pho soup which is excellent!

If you are in the mood for a variety of Asian food, Moto would not disappoint! I have been here several times and never had a bad meal. Everything from the pho to their custom rice bowls are delicious and very reasonable. The environment is really neat and wait staff is generally very welcoming. Two of my favorite dishes are the grilled chicken pho and the exit wound bowl (which is very spicy, seriously.)  The reason for the 4-Star review is sometimes the wait can be rather slow. Some food items seem to take much longer than others and leaves you waiting, in addition the wait staff can be a bit slow to respond to checks, drinks and other side requests.

Yes, this is worth making a trip for.  The happy hour menu is inexpensive and innovative (try out the Asian nachos), the sushi has been fresh on every visit, and some of the combos on the top-secret underground menu (ok maybe not so secret any more) compare to some of the best sushi I've had on the coast.  The atmosphere is kinda hip and urban. Service is always good. I notice the owner frequently on-site and working, which is a good thing.  After happy hour some of the mixed drinks can get sorta pricey, but not unreasonable.  So yes, check it out.

This place is decent. The prices are alright and the menu has a lot more than just sushi. The service has kind of depended on the time of day I have gone. The lunch service has always been pretty good, the dinner service was pretty slow. We waited 30-40 mins for our sushi order. They were pretty busy, but not THAT busy. It is a pretty small place so it can definitely be a little crowded, but it's a cute little place with good sushi.

This is the second time I have been here and I didn't write a review the first time because i wasn't that impressed. We wanted to give this place another try because our friends loved it.   I had the Stoner Bowl and was pleasantly surprised. It was absolutely delicious. So a sushi place selling a buffalo chicken, lettuce, ranch and rice bowl.   Yeah, it seemed like something you would eat after a late night of drinking. Very impressed. Huge portion of chicken, just a touch of ranch and white rice that goes perfect. I will be back again. Just shows you that you should always give a place a second chance.

We knew that something was wrong when this place was fairly empty on a Saturday night at 6pm.  First, the menu states if you order something and it's too spicy, tough shit, no returns or exchanges.  Second, the dragon roll price says market price. Seriously, what ingredient in a dragon roll fluctuates so much that it needs to be market price?  Third, the sushi is overpriced and lacks any fish. My rainbow roll had pieces of fish that were about 1-2mm thick.  Fourth, the service was slow. The roll came out about 15 minutes after the person I was with got her pho soup.  Fifth, this place feels like a money grab by the owner who doesn't care about his customers. Menu confirms this attitude. Scroll through the photos.
Thank you for paying attention and cleaning the grates !!
I'll give 0 stars to the bar wings, PLEASE BRING THE ORIGINAL "BAR WINGS" BACK!!!! New recipe is WAYYYY off!!! And bad tasting too!   Other than that a huge improvement in all other items!

I used to love this place. But now their happy hour sucks. They took the philly roll off happy hour and the Vegas roll, long story short the "good stuff" was eliminated off the happy hour menu. They are already stingy with the rolls as it is (extremely small rolls even smaller pieces of salmon per bite) and on top of that they're not available on happy hour, crazy! I have no problem with paying if it was good sized portions or at least quality fish but nope. Only giving it 3 stars because *some* of the staff is very friendly and the establishment itself is clean and cute. Other than that I'm not sure I'll be back soon and I will think twice before eating here again. Much rather go to Moira sushi in Downtown Phx their happy hour menu is awesome as well as the hours from 5-7pm on weekdays and weekends 9pm to 2 am

There are so many sushi Happy Hour places around, but wanted give this one a try.  The HH menu sushi selections only has four rolls  (Kalifornia, Philadelphia, Spicy tuna roll, and Tootsie roll).  I had ordered the Kalifornia and Tootsie roll.  You can really tell the experience of the Sushi Chef making the rolls.  The rolls are small, uneven, and about to fall apart.  We had also tried the Asian nacho, edamame, and gyoza. The Asian nacho was not bad.  I guess anything with cheese should blend well, most of time.  The best was the beer.  I think the name was Sweet Betty, can't remember.  I had to order two to enjoy with my sushi.  The service was alright, it could be better.

mmmmm.....moto!  Love this place.  Happy hour specials are awesome, beer selection is great and being harassed by the owner makes every visit complete.  Vince, keep up the good work!  You run one of my all time favorites!
As you can see we all agree that the food is worthy of 4 starts; but I can ensure you our server kamila made it a 5 star.   Happy hour isn't bad.

Service was incredibly slow. It seemed like they had maybe 3 people working, and we'd often wait (what felt like) 15 minutes to get any attention, even when I was just standing there waiting to be seated (or greeted, for that matter).  The menu is fairly comprehensive. The food is decent. I wasn't amazingly impressed, but I wasn't disappointed, either. Some of the prices seem steep. The atmosphere is kind of cramped and congested, but it was comfortable. Slightly loud, but you could still hear each other talk.  But considering that I lost my dinner after I got home, I'm okay with not going back. No huge loss here.

Ok, I am not into sushi, but this place is still good for the non-sushi person. This place is right down the street from my office and I have had the buffalo burger (great?), their moto wings are spicy and tasty, their yaki soba noodles are good and so are the sweet potatoe fries.   The wait staff is friendly and prompt.

Came here after a friend recommended it, and she told me to try the Asian Nachoes---and yes they were amazingly good!!    Vegas Roll, Spicy Tuna, and Dragon roll were all so very yummy!  Washed it all down with two glasses of Sapporo:)    The only thing i have to complain about is our server--she wasn't very nice and forgot our napkins when we asked for them a second time...but other than that good experience.    The location is easy to find--still in central phx.    Go during happy hour 4-6:15, half of selected sushi rolls and two bucks of beer.  Good appetizers as well.  Saturdays they have all you can eat sushi for 18 bucks from 11-2:30...not sure if i will do that, but never know.

The food is great most of the time. I feel like they have all new staff every time I go there. They are always showing FOX News Channel on multiple TVs, so that's a bit of a turn off. But yeah, the food is decent!

I took my daughter there for her 14th birthday on 12/17 and it was the worst service I have had in a long time. The waitress brought my food first and then my daughters sushi. If she was a good waitress she should have waited to put in my order so both orders came to the table together. It was 15 minutes before the "Birthday Girl" received her dinner. The sad part about this whole ordeal was she "chose" this restaurant for her birthday dinner. We were both so upset that we wanted to leave and  not tip the waitress. Unless the owners hire or train the waitresses better, we won't be back or refer this restaurant again. I see several bad reviews regarding service from months ago and yet here we are with terrible service. Doesn't say much about the owners or management. They really need to read all the reviews!!

This is a delicious neighborhood restaurant!  I can't speak to their sushi much because I have become such a fan of other items on the menu. The handful plus times I have had sashimi here it has always been good.  Now on to my favorites! The Asian nachos are a must get. Instead of tortilla chips they use wonton chips. Topped with a yummy cheese sauce, salsa, sour cream, and guacamole. Their guacamole is a mix of avocado and edamame. Yum! Add some chicken and these are super yummy and great for sharing.  During my most recent visit here I discovered they have a new edamame. Bun Bo Edamame. It's very spicy. Too spicy for my tongue but the friend I was with loved it.  Saved the best for last - the Mojo dessert. I am not a big dessert person, but I almost always order dessert here. It looks like a sushi roll. You get rice krispy treats, rolled up with Nutella, ice cream and a brownie in the middle. Delicious!!!

Go there for lunch often and I'm treated like Norm at Cheers. Love they remember my name. The servers and sushi chefs ( especially Ivan) can cut and roll some sushi! They have an underground menu you can pick from or just tell Ivan what you want in your roll ( custom)! I order the "Sasquatch" roll and I'm thoroughly satisfied. The noodles and any of the bowls there rival any sushi place around. They change out their beers weekly so you can enjoy many local brews. Try the "stoner" bowl and enjoy the spicy chicken/ ranch/ rice mix. Great for a hangover. It's local, its comfortable and it has a great happy hour on Friday.

Saturday: 11am-2:30: all you can eat sushi is only $16.95  pretty darn good sushi too.  not busy, you get a seat easily.  Nice but not a scene-- which is how I like to dine on sushi.  I have had better but at this price, this is as good as it will ever get!    I've only had sushi here, so I don't know what the other food is like, but the other tables had non-sushi meals and they looked good, big portions.    www.mrmotorising.com

I have a love/hate relationship with Moto... It's on my way home from work so it's an easy stop for takeout.  I've dined in a well.   I typically get the Beef Pho, extra beef and usually a small Papa Tran Riblets appetizer. When done right both are delicious. I love these riblets, they are addictive and are coated in salt and pepper and chili flakes. They are served dry and very addictive if you like a little heat you can't eat just one!   My beef with Moto is consistency, both on food and service.  I got takeout last night and the Pho was very good but the riblets just didn't have their normal coating of seasoning and it's the heat I really like. Don't get me wrong they were still good, but just not the same.  This is not an isolated incident it's happened several times where something is just off and also more than once they have actually left a whole dish or a component out of my order forcing me to return. It didn't happen last night because I've learned to double check.   When done right these two items are both very very good. I just wish they would be done right more often as you just never know here.  That said it's convenient and I keep going back because like I said when it's good when it's good.   Mojo's their version of an ice cream sushi rolled in Rice Krispie treats. Well you will have thought you died and went to heaven.  Super delicious.  You never know what flavor you are getting.   I've never had their sushi but I've dined in and had the Pad Thai which was also good.  Three stars for inconsistency of food preparation and service for pretty regularly leaving something out of a takeout order.
Absolutely love this place! The nachos are KILLER GOOD!!!!! Can't go wrong with this place!

Mutt-friendly microbrews - oh yea.  Hiking with Jaek recently one evening was culminated wonderfully with a tasty ale on their shaded patio.  Sure it was warm, but we were together - a boy and his dog and his beer.  Beautiful, man, beautiful.

AWKWARD as attending your ex husbands wedding to your former best friend...best way to sum up tonight's dinner at Moto.  Let me start with saying, I love Moto, come often, Charity and another server, tall, dark hair, black rimmed glasses, tattoos (mad at myself I can't recall his name right now) are amazing. Know the menu, attentive and personable without being fake and obnoxious. I honestly will wait for a table in their section rather than risk not having the experience I've become custom to. Tonight...I will keep it as brief as I can. - gentleman who sat us was literally dripping in sweat. It's July, it's miserable I get it. It was not really getting my appetite going watching him drip all over our menus clearly frazzled. - the restaurant was clearly way busier than anyone expected given its summer and 7 pm on a Thursday. They were understaffed, but hey, it's summer in AZ. Things slow down.  - the ONLY people who appeared frazzled and annoyed the restaurant was busy...was the swamp monster who sat us (assuming some sort of lead / management position and a man in a purple polo. The servers and the ONLY sushi chef seemed to be on point and not showing the customers any sort of panic.  Let's talk about purple polo. It was unclear if he was a off duty Moto fun police officer. Customer who self appointed himself as the boss. Or just an unhappy man on a mission to ruin everyone's night. He spent 85% of his time sitting at the bar socializing with what appeared to be regulars, and the 15% terrorizing the staff with his overly anxious approach.  He actually felt it was necessary and appropriate to pull out server outside right in front of the CLEAR glass door for everyone to to see him, what appeared to be grilling her. Regardless if it was a slap on the wrist or a celebration of her great service. Not appropriate, and unprofessional. The restaurant was packed and she was clearly capable of handling her tables...well until he removed her to publicly humiliate her. It was unprofessional and a poor example of what I assume would be management? Save it for off hours. Oh, and maybe not chill at the bar while your understaffed restaurant busts their asses and then ridicule and undermine them in front of their customers. Normally, I would give 5 stars to Moto. My husband and I left dinner from one of our favorite places disgusted and mortified by the stranger in the purple polos' strange and unprofessional behavior. I hope he reads this review and feels ashamed and apologizes to his hard working staff.

If ever a great neighborhood bar existed, this is the place.  The dedication to an atmosphere that stays hip, knows its customers, and evolves to capture your heart and palette remains the core of this perennial hit year after year.    From the great happyhour, to the ribs on sundays, to the new addition of vietnamese cusine there is nothing on the menu that isn't ready to bring a smile to your face.  Every time my friends can't decide where to go, I respond, Moto!  Everyone finds a dish or sushi roll that fits their mood and a brew that compliments the moment.  That alone gets them 4 stars, the 5th star is reserved for having one of the best desserts in town, the Mojo....ice cream sushi.....

Just left this place after ordering sushi and waiting 1hr20min and left hungry. Food never came with Slow Hand Jack at the sushi bar...tho orders put in after ours were filled. We were given a table meant for 2 and squeezed our threesome in. And to top it off, we were still charged full price for our drinks and soup. LAME! Hana's on 7th Ave is the place to be! Take heed!!!

Two words for you- caramel wings. They are the best wings I've ever had, and I'm one of those girls who doesn't eat wings in public, but one whiff of the Caramel garlic goodness and I inhaled half my friend's order. Love. Also, Moto sports a rockin beer lineup which is almost unheard of in a sushi joint-they have happy hour every day of the week! The sushi was good, I'm a huge fan of the bowls myself. And every single time I've been there (a dozen? More?) I've had stellar service. Super awesome staff, lovely ambience, awesome food and beer!! Go to moto, you will love it!

I really wish I liked this place more. It's hip! It's modern! It's kind of edgy! And I love sushi!  But every time I go I leave feeling a little disappointed with my meal. The sushi is only ok. And I can't seem to find anything else on the menu that I like. Soup is bland, BBQ pork was ok but not great, spring rolls nothing to write home about.  I'll go here if someone else wants to and just deal, but I'll won't  choose to go on my own.
Worst pho I have ever had!! Rubbery beef, crunchy noodles and tasteless broth.... Look else where for Pho!!!

So, the closing time says 9ish. We walked in at 830pm and asked if they were still open. The hostess said yes and seated us. As soon as we sat down the server came over and said since it was 830 there were certain rolls we couldn't order. We told her what we wanted since we already knew and she agreed that we could order those rolls. As we were waiting they started putting up the chairs on the tables around us. Then she walked out with our sushi that looked very sloppily put together and also put our check down at the same time. At this point we felt extremely rushed and annoyed. I wish when we walked in she would have said they were closing, then we wouldn't have even bothered. So, we got mediocre sushi and were rushed out. We both felt annoyed about the entire experience.  Usually its pretty decent, I would say excellent or good, just decent and this time it wasn't even that. Might be a while before we give it another chance.
this place has awesome sushi. get the tootsie roll or one of the spicy bowls. the staff is very friendly.
I always have a good time when I dine in though I tend to get it to go because I live around the corner!  Good Spring rolls and my wife loves the sushi!

This place is right around the corner from me and have been here several fans. Anyone who know me, knows I`m a sushi whore so why write about non sushi items you ask? Well I was more impressed with the non sushi items! Don`t get me wrong, sushi is ok here but I have had better elsewhere.  What I did enjoy was the trying the Exit Wound bowl. Super spicy crispy shrimp, chicken and veggies was delicious! Maybe being winter, this was a perfect choice for something that warmed me up and boy it sure did! I am curious about the Classified bowl which is rated a 6 fire on the hot scale, and says on the menu: Do Not Order!!) My Exit Wound bowl was rated a 4 fire!

OK - I'll be honest... I LOVE their food (especially the sushi).  But their service can be REALLY bad.  I've had to re-order drinks multiple times, wait long times for a check at the table...  and most recently I tried to place a pick up order over the phone.    I asked to pick up my food in 1 hour, they asked why I was calling so far in advance... I explained that I was going to be in a meeting and couldn't call back in 30 minutes to place the order.  Their response was that they would have it ready in 20 minutes, but I didn't want my sushi sitting for another 40 minutes before I picked it up.  They said they couldn't guarantee to have it ready in an hour.  SERIOUSLY?  You're kidding, right?  So, I hung up and won't be doing that again.  I also cancelled my plans with a group of 14 friends to have dinner there this weekend... we're going to Stingray instead.    I've lost my patience with Moto.  Yea, the food is good - but the service is just so ridiculously bad...

I visit Moto's at least once a month. I usually come after one of a business group's membership meetings.  Our group has even used Moto's to have quick board meetings.  When I show up at 4:30 I'm still on my workday and use my computer and headset on my phone and take a table away from others.  This was the first time I found the service less than. Was told by waitress I was rude because I was on the phone. And when I asked for water I was brought a bill.  The busboy then started to clear the table with wine still in my glass before I even got up.  I think I'll be finding a new place to go to after our meetings and will find a new place for our members to have a quick impromptu meetings. #BadService #BadVibe #FoodWasNeverGreat  This is the first bad review I have ever left, check my others.

This place has gone down hill. Happy hour prices are up but quality has gone down. They used to have satisfactory drinks but now they're extremely watered down. And when I complained the manager said some bull and said she couldn't take it off the bill. Never coming here again.

Love the place and the servers but PLEASE stop with the 'fifty's' look?  What would be appealing about a cool neighborhood bar that has the poor staff wearing gas station shirts and headbands.  Really.  These are wonderful people being dressed like they are 50 years old and looking silly.  I'm not the only person that says this. I just took the time to say it. Please. Please, something modern.  We won't bring friends here from out of town because it looks so dated.  (Not the servers themselves - love them.) But the silly outfits they are forced to wear.

I don't go to Moto very often, even though it's across the street from my  house.  I've really only been for dinner and take out.  It's been good, standard fare.  Nothing spectacular, but good.  The fish has been better than some places.  And the AYCE sushi special on Saturdays for $15.95 is a great deal.  Today I went to lunch with a PG girlfriend, so, no raw fish for her.  We decided to share two dishes, the sweet & sour shrimp and the veggie pad thai.  While the serving of pad thai was huge, I thought that $8.95 for no meat was a little steep, it's $12.95 to add chicken, beef, shrimp or tofu.  And the shrimp bowl was good, the sauce was tasty and not too sweet, but only 5 pieces of shrimp.  Not a value.  Since they don't have a lunch menu, I think I'll stick to Moto for happy hour and for dinner and AYCE on Saturdays.

I just moved to the neighborhood, and I LOVE this place. In fact, I should probably give it 5 stars, but I haven't had the sushi there yet. I always get a rice bowl, and the crispy tofu is delicious! I've also had the salmon, and I thought the flavor was great, but the portion was a little small. My favorite thing on the menu is the red curry crab bisque soup, which is out of this world! (I just wish they had a smaller portion that wasn't $5 because I feel like I end up buying 2 dinners).  We tried the rice krispies rolled in ice cream for dessert, and I didn't think that was all that great - it sounds better on the menu than it actually is. You won't be disappointed here.

The sushi here is amazingly delicious, super fresh, and there are a wide variety of choices. Miso soup is also quite nice as are the gyoza dumplings. This small (ish) place was hopping on a Friday night and we were happy to have reservations for our party of eight. We arrived about a half-hour early prepared to have a drink from the bar and wait for our 6:30 reservation. The hostess was not happy about this. I'm not sure why since we spent plenty of money at the bar AND we sat outside in the late afternoon summer heat. But her displeasure continued when she sat us as well. If the first person you meet in a restaurant is not friendly and welcoming, it sets a bad tone. Our wait staff was efficient and friendly however, and all was quite tasty. We'll revisit Moto because of the food and service, certainly not from the less than welcoming vibe upon entry.

Great beers, delicious food, awesome service. I love this place! The atmosphere is fun and everyone is great. I had the calamari, spring rolls, seaweed salad, and sweet potato fries. Everything was top notch.

Our second time here.  Be warned that Saturday afternoons are busy, they offer an all you can eat sushi deal.  We were not impressed by the sushi last time we were here, so that wasn't an objective.  Instead, we had crispy fried gyozo and tacos, both shrimp and BBQ pork.  The fried dumplings were excellent, I think they were deep-fried as they were crispy all around, I'm not sure you can do that with a skillet, and I have no problem with that.  The dipping sauce was decent but not exceptional.  The tacos were great, I loved my BBQ beef and my wife liked the shrimp.  Two tacos per plate made an excellent late lunch, very good portion size to be full but not stuffed.  I do have to take exception to their guacamole.  I fully understand that they're going for an Asian, not Mexican, vibe for their guac, but it needed seasoning.  I'm not sure what, but I found the flavor kind of flat.  My wife thought it had enough salt, it just needed something to kick up the flavor a little.  Also, the wonton chips for scooping it?  Their strength is not up to the weight of the guac.  We had the Mojo's for dessert, basically it's an ice cream sushi roll.  The ice cream flavor can vary day-to-day, today it was strawberry.  The two pieces that we got were an excellent cap to good food.  Service was not good.  We had to flag down our server for refills for our tea, for a box for the fries to take home for our poodle, for the check.  They were kinda busy, still, it's what they're paid and tipped for.  And finally, and sadly, whatever it was that I was smelling six months ago was still there.  I'm still not sure whether it's cleaning products or sushi, but it was something that really didn't sit well with my nose.  Still, we liked the food and will definitely consider them for future eats.

I was really excited to go out to dinner Friday night, because I hadn't seen my honey in a week and a half. And what better than sushi and a saki bomber to ease back into each other?  We arrived at 8:50 p.m. and were seated almost immediately. In the back. Trying to review our menus in the near darkness wasn't easy. Ten minutes pass as tables around us get hovering attention. We, however, weren't even offered drinks. Just when I was calling Hana to see how late they were serving, someone finally came up to us for our drink order and appetizers. Our soup and appetizer came before our drinks. The Duece was our main course and mediocre at best. I'm used to my sushi/sashimi being a little cooler than room temp.  I echo the comments about a limited menu.  Sorry, but I wasn't impressed. That doesn't mean I won't try again...but I don't see myself waiting another 10 minutes while those around me are being serviced.

Well, it dropped a star for me, and I'll tell you why. Eaten there probably 20 time in the last quarter. I've had it all; All you can eat sushi, bowls, desert, beer. Ate alone, ate with Sandra K, ate with son and family (including 3 year old grandson who plays drums with the chopsticks) had a party of 12 there.  Service....slow on Saturday for the AYES, otherwise I can't complain. There are some "bright" spots. First, it's close to my neighborhood, a start and there is more than sushi and that is helpful when you have non-sushi lovers with you. The bowls are very good and you can order them in the heat index you like. Funny names to them as well, like the "Exit Wound Bowl" or "The Classified Bowl with this description;Don't Order this Bowl".  Squid Salad is great, great, great! Calamari, ok. Hey they put a lot of thought into their beer selection and that is cool. And their dessert sushis are very unique.  As for the sushi....I now have way too many sushi restaurants to try and they are all falling over themselves for your business. Sushi has become really "hip" lately but there will be a fall out in this category as the economy continues to slow and people, let's face it, are pulling back. This is not a place for a sushi purist, but give me good food, a cool gathering place (close to my central Phoenix abode) and I will be there. Sushi has got to get better for me to rate higher and "earn" my business.

Came here for lunch with a friend today. I had remember reading about the Asian nachos on Yelp and we ordered the small, without chicken. They were so YUMMY! Definitely something I would go back for. My friend and I were both pretty hungry and we polished off the small with no problem between the two of us.   She ordered the Pad Thai Noodles and I opted for the California roll, with the real crab meat for the $1 up-charge. My friend said her dish was okay but she left a lot on her plate, though it was a huge portion. My Cali roll was pretty good, but kind of dry. I don't  think I've ever left a piece of sushi on my plate and I actually did this time around. I wasn't overly full either though so I think it just wasn't that great. It was a pretty large roll, 8 pieces, and each piece required two bites rather than the normal one piece, one bite.   Service was pretty good. Our waitress kept our glasses full but disappear when we were waiting to pay. She also charged the wrong credit card for each of our tabs but corrected it, hopefully.   Overall, I'd definitely go back for those nachos and to try something else on the menu.

Moto is a great spot for an inexpensive full service lunch with a fair selection.  People are dogging the sushi, but its pretty good, especially for a place that isn't exclusively sushi.  My only gripe is their light beer selection is limited to Bud Light - everything else is IPA or Asian beer.  what's better than a Coors Light with Asian food?!  Nothing.
